name: Townhouse in Jersey City · ★4.77 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
description:
Full disclosure - professional photographs make my place look larger and brighter!

Downtown Jersey City, two blocks to the PATH train!

First floor room w/ queen size bed, private bathroom, and access to the backyard. I live on the 2nd and 3rd floor.

Amenities outside the bedroom: small table and chairs, desk and office chair, microwave, toaster oven, mini fridge, electric kettle, utensils, utility sink for washing dishes. No access to upstairs full kitchen.

The space
Conveniently located on the first floor of my townhouse (no stairs). Queen size bed, closet, tv, wifi, ceiling fan and window a/c. Right next to the room is your own private bathroom. There is also a door to the backyard so you can enjoy some outdoor space.

2 adults, or 2 adults with 1 small child can comfortably fit in the room.

My roommate, dog and I live on the second and third floors. You will only see us coming in or out at the front door.
neighborhood_overview:
Downtown Jersey City is right outside of Manhattan, and has great restaurants, bars, and shops all within walking distance. There are parks nearby as well. If you walk 10 minutes to the waterfront you will get spectacular views of Manhattan. A large shopping mall and grocery store are also a couple blocks away. I have lived here over 15 years and feel very safe.

Other local attractions include Hoboken and Liberty State Park which has ferry service to the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, and Manhattan.
host_about: I live in Jersey City and am a WFH graphic artist. I love travel, the beach, and helping people have a great stay in the NYC area.

The loft space is located in Jersey City's Journal Square neighborhood, and just a 7 minute walk to Journal Square Path train station. Downtown Manhattan is 3 stops from the station - about a 12 minute ride.

neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is seconds from "Little India", which offers low-budget to formal Indian dining, in addition to Filipino, Latin American, and Egyptian cuisine, reflecting the city's wide ethnic population. Downtown Jersey City is also minutes away and offers a big variety of Bars and Restaurants.

Jersey City is just across the Hudson river, and it's closer and better connected to the heart of Manhattan than some boroughs and locations in New York City. It is literally 10 minutes away from Downtown Manhattan by subway (path train) and 15mn away from Greenwich Village and midtown. The Path Train runs all day and all night on a schedule.
host_about:
I am an artist working with movement and stuff. Originally from Italy. 
I travel often with art projects and use airbnb and I equally allow other people to use my apartments in the NYC area. My places are simple nothing luxurious but with good energy if you are into that, and I try to keep the price affordable. I am co founder and co-director of a non profit dance organization called Shua Group and co founder of  an artist run  space in Jersey City called Shuaspace, an incubator for ideas an community actions. Thank you for supporting all this as it is harder and harder for artists to keep their work going in the expensive New York City area. 
Thank you!

description:
Our guests tell us that they love coming back to the apartment - that it feels like home. We want our guests to know that even though you can see the Empire State Building from the apartment, it still takes about 45 minutes to get into Manhattan.

The space
Lovely newly renovated, 4 room apartment with separate entrance in private Victorian home in Jersey City Heights - close to New York City.

Quiet tree lined street with view of Empire State Building and a green backyard in the spring and summer. Two bedrooms - one with full size bed for a couple, and the other with a single bed. Sheets and towels are of course provided. The living room also has a futon which can accommodate another two people. (The price for additional guests is $10. per person for children and $20. for adults) Great kitchen with all new appliances and everything you need to cook. Very spacious and clean bathroom with hair dryer, shampoo and conditioner and some other basic toiletr
neighborhood_overview: Our area of Jersey City Heights is quiet and safe and yet just a short bus or train ride to the middle of Manhattan. Guests tell us they enjoy coming back to the quiet of our apartment after a busy day in NYC.
host_about: My husband Harry and I work(ed) in the creative arts.  I recently retired. We have lived in this area all of our lives except for two years in London. We have traveled abroad and look forward to meeting people from across the globe.  We are happy to share our insights about where to go in the NYC area.  We have two children who are no longer living at home so we decided to convert our top floor into this lovely vacation rental.  It is a completely separate apartment from our own.  We look forward to having visitors stay in this apartment. We speak some Spanish.

KITCHEN with supplies s
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is safe and trendy. It’s a great neighborhood for New York City commuters and travelers as well as for those that want to enjoy a bit more calmness than Manhattan while being minutes away from it.

Aside from the proximity to the underground transportation with Manhattan and other parts of New Jersey, you will have in less than 5 minutes walk a large diversity of exciting cafes, restaurants, bars, shops, yoga studios, gyms and a great supermarket (Keyfood).

In less than 15 minutes walk you will reach a large shopping mall, a multiplex movie theater, several parks, and the riverside with some of the best views in the New York Metropolitan Area. If you want more shopping, next to the Newport Mall, you can find Shoprite, BJ’S Wholesale, Bed Bath & Beyond, The Home Depot and Target.
host_about: Spanish architect with offices in New York, Miami, Madrid, and Chennai. Passionate about traveling and understanding other ways of living and thinking. I had the fortune to live and work on five continents. I use Airbnb to both host and travel as a guest.

Large apartment in Downtown Jersey City, steps from the Grove street Path station, less than 10 minutes away from Downtown Manhattan (World Trade Center.)

The space
Situated on the ground floor of a 19th century townhouse, this open-space apartment is spacious, quiet and fun. It features hardwood floors, a small kitchen with direct access to the garden. There is a queen-sized bed as well as a comfortable futon, so four persons can easily stay in the apartment. There's also a nice-sized closet space and an empty chest of drawers.

The living room has a seating area with DirectTV and free Wifi. The kitchen has a gas range, a fridge, a microwave as well as basic utensils and a washing machine for the laundry. The bathroom has a bathtub/shower.

The apartment is located in Historic Downtown Jersey City, just across the Hudson river from Manhattan (only 2 blocks from the Grove street PATH subway which offer direct and 24/7 acc
neighborhood_overview:
Mercer Street is in the heart of Historic Downtown/Van Vorst areas of Jersey City anchored by the Grove Street PATH station. When not exploring Manhattan, there is much to do in Jersey City. These include:
* walking along the Hudson River Waterfront for great views of Manhattan or venturing over to Hoboken for the great bar scene
* checking out the great restaurants in the area
* visiting massive Liberty State Park which has ferry service to Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty
* taking the kids to the Liberty Science Center
* attending the Farmers' Market or the live music performances at Grove Square: http://www.jcdowntown.org/
* shopping at the Newport Center Mall or the local boutiques scattered on Grove Street or finding a bargain at the flea market on Saturday's at Van Vorst Park
host_about: We love to travel and meet new people. Bob is originally from Connecticut and Francois from France, we've been living in NY/NJ for twenty years. We also like art, music and movies. And we both speak French and English! Due to our busy schedule, one of us will be your host in the listing of your choosing. Welcome to Jersey City and New York!

name: Serviced apartment in Jersey City · ★4.60 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Soaring 50 stories above the Hudson River, this glamorous tower has everything a traveler would need (and more!) for a trip to the NYC metro. Enjoy all the bells and whistles, including:
- Upscale furnishings, tall ceilings, and gourmet kitchens in every unit
- Resort-style building amenities such as an outdoor pool, theater room, gym, and 24/7 concierge
- Light rail steps from the front door and easy access to PATH
- Walkable neighborhood a block from Newport Centre

The space
Why stay in Manhattan when you can savor the peace and quiet of this luxurious Jersey City high-rise? Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Fifth Avenue, this Downtown Jersey City building is a better value than anything you’d find across the Hudson - and you can still get to NYC in minutes via the ferry or the PATH train.

Rest and relax in this peaceful oasis perched on the edge of the river, which features plush mattresses, sophisticated wood f
neighborhood_overview:
Why stay in Manhattan when you can savor the peace and quiet of this luxurious Jersey City high-rise? Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Fifth Avenue, this Downtown Jersey City building is a better value than anything you’d find across the Hudson - and you can still get to NYC in minutes via the ferry or the PATH train.

Rest and relax in this peaceful oasis perched on the edge of the river, which features plush mattresses, sophisticated wood furnishings, and spacious closets so you can unpack and stay for a while. In the bathroom, you’ll find masterful tile work and modern fixtures - plus towels and toiletries provided for your convenience.

After a day at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, a matinee show on Broadway, or a packed agenda of meetings, you’re bound to be hungry, Cook up a storm in the full kitchen, which features stainless steel appliances, including a full-size fridge and freezer, an electric stove, an oven, a microwave, and a dishwashe
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

Large and sunny top floor 1br/1ba apartment with high ceilings and a private deck available in the heart of historic downtown Jersey City, the “Village” area, close to New York City.

This beautifully decorated apartment takes up the entire floor of a charming early 20th century brownstone building. Perfect for tourists and business travelers visiting NJ and NYC.

- Nice, spacious living room with a high ceiling, comfy couch, TV, dining table and chairs and a well equipped kitchen area

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.73 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Art studio apt. in downtown Jersey City. Completely renovated with custom Murphy bed, radiant floor heating and A/C, gas cooktop, bathroom w/walk-in shower, and private street entrance. It is a 12-min. walk to PATH station; then two stops to World Trade Center (NYC) or 6 stops to mid-town NYC.

The space
This ground floor, studio apartment is in downtown Jersey City, where I live part of the year. You have one full-time neighbor upstairs. The building was originally built in 1885 but fully renovated in 2015. The apartment is a studio and has a water heater and water pump in the unit that run occasionally. You will occasionally hear the appliances as well as the upstairs guest footfall ... Ear plugs for sleeping are the simple solution if complete silence is needed.

Guest access
You will have access to the entire studio apartment and small backyard.

Other things to note
Parking is limited in Jersey City so I don't re
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is exploding with new restaurants, high rises, and notoriety ... it is the new hot spot to live in the NYC metro area. You will find one of the best restaurants (Madame Claude's) one block from my place, but there are lots of great bars and restaurants nearby.

RESTAURANTS/BARS:
Madame Claude's - amazing French food, killer brunch, fantastic Parisian music Thursday nights ... get a reservation. (1 min. walk)
Cellar 335 - very cool spot, global eats, tiki themed (1 min)
White Star - local dive bar w/solid food (3 min.)
Porta - great pizza (10 min.)
Taqueria - best Mexican food around, great fish/pork tacos (13 min.)
Talde - pricey, but memorable (10 min.)
Mathews - upscale, menu for everyone (12 min.)
Ibby's Falafel - great falafel sandwich (14 min.)
Pet Shop - used to be local pet shop, now it's a bar (8 min.)
Dullboy - cocktail lounge hip w/NYC vibe (12 min.)
BeClaws - if you want seafood (7 min
host_about:
I am an innovation scout for the construction industry.  I love what I do ... and travel quite a bit.  I live part of the year in Jersey City, part of the year in AZ, and part of the year in NC. 

Cheerio

name: Home in Jersey City · ★4.90 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
description:
Private, large apt in Victorian House in Historic Lincoln Park section of Jersey City. 1 mile to JSQ PATH train to NYC/Hoboken. Bus on corner to NYC! Hardwd flrs, 12 foot ceilings, new kitchen, 1.5 baths, 2 BR, sofa in bedroom and living room (no sleeper sofa), TV, WiFi, laundry.

The space
1st flr apt of beautiful Victorian House in Historic Lincoln Park section of Jersey City. We have installed brand new central A/C and heat system! Stunning hardwood floors have been redone, 12 foot ceilings, new kitchen, 1.5 baths, 2 BR (1 queen, 1 full) , FIOS TV, WiFi cable, laundry. 1 mi from JSQ PATH train to NYC/Hoboken. Bus on corner to NYC!

This is a beautiful, comfortable space with all the amenities you may need. You can walk 50 yards to catch the NJ Transit #10 bus that brings you 1 mile to Journal Square where you can catch the PATH train to NYC, Hoboken or Newark, which connects you to NJ Transit trains to everywhere! You can also catch the #119 bus
neighborhood_overview:
It is one mile from the Journal Square transportation center (JSQ on the PATH line). From JSQ, you can take the PATH to Newark and catch the NJ Transit trains. You can also go to Hoboken, World Trade Center or take the 33rd Street line to Greenwich Village or uptown. It takes less than one hour to get to 33rd St via PATH. There is a bus stop right on the corner about 100 feet away. From there, you can get the bus to JSQ or directly into Port Authority in NYC, which puts you right near Times Square and the theater district. The bus to Port Authority usually takes 45-60 minutes. We are one block from Lincoln Park, which offers great walks and opportunities to work out, including jogging paths and a track.
We are 5 blocks from St. Peter's University, 1.5 miles to NJCU and a mile from Hudson County Community College.
We are also very close to Liberty State Park, which is one of the most visited state parks in the country! You can get a ferry to the Statue of Liberty or Ellis Is
host_about: I am a lifelong resident of Jersey City, NJ. I work in Hoboken, NJ. I also have spent much of my life at the Jersey Shore. I travel a fair amount and spend a lot of time in New England, specifically Maine and Martha's Vineyard. I am a hairdresser and musician. Piano is my main instrument. I am also a licensed social worker in NJ!  If you are coming to the NJ/NY area, I hope you consider staying here at the beautiful apartment in the Dr. Norton House! I can help you find all sorts of great things to do and places to eat and visit. Contact me for any further questions or info!

Soaring 50 stories above the Hudson River, this glamorous tower has everything a traveler would need (and more!) for a trip to the NYC metro. Enjoy all the bells and whistles, including:
- Upscale furnishings, tall ceilings, and gourmet kitchens in every unit
- Resort-style building amenities such as an outdoor pool, theater room, gym, and 24/7 concierge
- Light rail steps from the front door and easy access to PATH
- Walkable neighborhood a block from Newport Centre

The space
Why stay in Manhattan when you can savor the peace and quiet of this luxurious Jersey City high-rise? Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Fifth Avenue, this Downtown Jersey City building is a better value than anything you’d find across the Hudson - and you can still get to NYC in minutes via the ferry or the PATH train.

Rest and relax in this peaceful oasis perched on the edge of the river, which features plush mattresses, sophisticated wood f
neighborhood_overview:
Why stay in Manhattan when you can savor the peace and quiet of this luxurious Jersey City high-rise? Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Fifth Avenue, this Downtown Jersey City building is a better value than anything you’d find across the Hudson - and you can still get to NYC in minutes via the ferry or the PATH train.

Rest and relax in this peaceful oasis perched on the edge of the river, which features plush mattresses, sophisticated wood furnishings, and spacious closets so you can unpack and stay for a while. In the bathroom, you’ll find masterful tile work and modern fixtures - plus towels and toiletries provided for your convenience.

After a day at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, a matinee show on Broadway, or a packed agenda of meetings, you’re bound to be hungry, Cook up a storm in the full kitchen, which features stainless steel appliances, including a full-size fridge and freezer, an electric stove, an oven, a microwave, and a dishwashe
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.83 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Enjoy a beautiful, private, non-smoking apt in a two-family home blocks from Liberty State Park in Jersey City, close to ferry to NYC Manhattan and light rail which connects to PATH train. Full kitchen w/ dishwasher, tub/shower, desk for working from home, private outdoor area. Queen-size bedroom & a couch in living room. Whether you come to see New York on a budget in comfort, or stay to get the feel of Jersey City living, this is a wonderful, welcoming place.

The space
This apartment is wonderfully furnished and stocked with all the essentials. Everything you need for a great stay is here...full kitchen, dishwasher, Queen-size bed, comfortable couch, desk & desk chair, board games, fresh linens, maps, etc. We also have a pack and play if you are traveling with a little one. Private, clean and well-stocked. We do have a tv with HDMI input cord but we do NOT have cable, so if you are going on vacation to watch a lot of tv this probably isn't the right apt for yo
neighborhood_overview: We are just blocks away from Liberty State Park where you can get a great view of the Statue of Liberty and the Manhattan skyline. Our neighborhood (Lafayette) was home to Lenape and then one of the oldest Dutch settlements in the area. We are now an urban area close to light rail and ferry. The PATH train is a 20 minute walk or take the light rail to connect.
host_about: We are a family who loves living in Jersey City. We are involved in community groups working to make this a wonderful place to live, work and play.  We live on a quiet, family-friendly street and enjoy using Liberty State Park and all of the other amenities our area offers. We also love to travel, and our favorite places to visit so far are the west coast of Ireland, Prague, San Francisco and the Yucatan peninsula. We like to be active when traveling- to learn the history of a place. When hosting we love for our guests to learn the same. We will give you as much or as little advice/direction as you want and most of all we want you to enjoy this place as much as we do.

This is a large 2-room fully furnished studio apartment (650 sqft) in the garden level of a historic row house (circa 1843) in a historic district of Jersey City for a sublet minimum of 30 days and a maximum of 95 days. Private entrance from street and yard. Location Best! The bedding is very comfortable with a quality queen mattress and bedding. Extremely clean and comfortable.

The space
This is a three-room studio garden-level apartment. All appliances are new. This small apartment has a private entrance from the street and to the rear yard. The yard is quiet and private. This historic townhouse is not only in the best neighborhood of Jersey City but on the best street of Jersey City with easy access to ferries or a subway to NYC, plus all the restaurants that the local area has to offer are within walking distance. The apartment is super immaculate and clean. Comments from prior guests are that the apartment far exceeded their expectations.

<
neighborhood_overview: The Paulus Hook Historic District of Jersey City is in very close proximity to downtown and midtown New York City (Manhattan).  You can take the ferry or path trains to various locations.
host_about:
I spent 20 years on Wall Street as a Risk Manager.  I live here with my family (wife and 7 year old son and 8 year old daughter).  This row house was built in 1843.  I am a CPA and I have an MBA in finance.  I attended NYU and Fordham University.  My family and I live in the top three floors and are making available the garden level.  The garden level is a separate apartment and this building is a legal two family.  The garden level was recently restored and most everything in it is new except for a few items.  The yard is quiet and the apartment has a private entrance from both the street and yard.  

My wife and I typically travel to the Caribbean islands and prefer quiet locations such as Anguilla, St John's, Tortola, Barbuda, the Grenadine Islands or the Outer Islands of the Bahamas.  Because of our children we have not traveled to Europe or other far places in recent years.  We also travel to Maine, Vermont and Cape Code during the summer months.

The huge, arched windows let in all the light. And the crank out window panes catch just the right amount of breeze. The windows are so beautiful, we don't use window coverings (and thankfully don't have to worry about privacy with the tree in the front). Comfortable for 4-5, guests enjoy an entertainment alcove featuring a 14-game including mini-pool, foosball and air hockey. Xbox Kinect and wireless Sonos sound system with millions of songs at your fingertips. Relaxed lounge/living area with television. Dining seating for four-six including a Stokke childseat. neighborhood_overview: You are in the center of it all.  The convenience of everything is right outside your door including cafes, restaurants, banks, the post office, businesses, waterfront ferries and trains to New York City.
host_about:
My husband and I are a young professional couple with two young children who love to travel. We know what we like for our family when we travel, so we make sure to keep items around our homes so people will feel like they are home.

Having been educated at the prestigious hotel and restaurant school at Cornell University, we learned from the best how to treat guests.  We enjoy taking care of the small details and touches that show how much we care -- a shiny bathroom sink, tucked and smooth bedding or a basket of goodies --we look for those same details when we travel.

Our motto is to do everything with excellence as if God is watching -- because He is! :-)

host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.87 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Studio at a recently renovated building. Approx 230 sqft (23m2) (small but you will have the convenience of total privacy and a whole studio for yourself). Long built-in closets with sliding doors South orientation & two large windows. Fridge available (No kitchen, stove or oven available). High-speed Internet. 5-Minutes walk to Path at Grove Station. 20 min to Manhattan. 5-minute walk to facilities like supermarkets, laundries. No Pets. Storage available off-unit.

The space
LIVING & BEDROOM: The apartment includes a QUEEN-SIZE bed and a large closet. We provide sets of linens and towels for your use. The bedroom also included a table and two chairs to fit, comfortably a group of 2 people.

KITCHEN: There is no kitchen where you can cook in the studio but there is a sink in case you want to order or prepare something simple at the counter. there is a small fridge.

BATHROOM: enjoy the rain shower in the bathroom.

STORAGE: For the
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is safe and trendy. It’s a great neighborhood for New York City commuters and travelers as well as for those that want to enjoy a bit more calmness than Manhattan while being minutes away from it.

Aside from the proximity to the underground transportation with Manhattan and other parts of New Jersey, you will have in less than 5 minutes walk a large diversity of exciting cafes, restaurants, bars, shops, yoga studios, gyms and a great supermarket (Keyfood).

In less than 15 minutes walk you will reach a large shopping mall, a multiplex movie theater, several parks, and the riverside with some of the best views in the New York Metropolitan Area. If you want more shopping, next to the Newport Mall, you can find Shoprite, BJ’S Wholesale, Bed Bath & Beyond, The Home Depot and Target.

Enjoy this studio, that accommodates 2 people. It also includes wifi and TV.
host_about: Spanish architect with offices in New York, Miami, Madrid, and Chennai. Passionate about traveling and understanding other ways of living and thinking. I had the fortune to live and work on five continents. I use Airbnb to both host and travel as a guest.

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.87 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Less than 15 minutes from Manhattan by PATH- Vibrant downtown Jersey City offers diverse restaurants, authentic French and Italian bakeries, quaint parks, farmer's markets and a night time Hudson River view of the sparkling New York City skyline. We are certified as a short term rental.

The space
Bright and quiet one bedroom apartment located in Historic Downtown. Five blocks from the Grove Street PATH Station.
One queen sized bed, and a full sized futon in the living room. The apartment is not ideal for four adults but works well for families of 4 or less when 2 are children.
We also have pack-n-play for small children or babies.
And plenty of closet space in the entry hall.
Washer and dryer and a grocery store a block away.

Guest access
Guests have access to their own washer/dryer and have private access to and from the apartment.

Other things to note
We welcome our guests from all around the
neighborhood_overview: Ideal location for a New York visit.  Plenty of hip spots here in Jersey City - but let's face it - New York is right next door!
host_about: Jennifer and Roland fell in love in Washington DC, and now live in their dream home in downtown Jersey City.  Jennifer works in Midtown Manhattan and Roland works in his home-office.  They have three teenagers - real New Yorkers, smart, sassy and worldly.  And they travel often to see their family in California, Israel, France and Germany.  Come and stay with us!

neighborhood_overview:
Modern residences across the 300-acre community, which is home to 15,000 people, feature spacious, light-filled apartments with stunning views of the Manhattan skyline. Residences feature open layouts with hardwood floors, oversized windows, 24-hour doorman services, parking and laundry facilities. Several buildings include a variety of amenities including a rooftop lounge, screening room, fitness center, and children’s playroom.

Along the waterfront, you will find the community’s signature waterfront park, featuring the only urban beach on the Hudson River. In the summer, it also hosts events exclusively for residents, including outdoor movie screenings, live concerts and festivals. And also features eight sleek corporate office towers comprising nearly six million square feet of Class A office space.

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights, often simply called The Heights, is a pleasant, somewhat densely packed residential neighborhood in the northern section of Jersey City, which in turn is the second-largest city in the state of New Jersey.

Homes in the area can be most often found in the two- and three-family detached houses which sit on small lots and which dominate the housing stock here, or in the low-rise apartment buildings that also are a considerable presence in the neighborhood. There are also more than a few stately old Victorian and Edwardian houses scattered throughout the streets of the Heights with rental apartments within, especially on Sherman Place and Summit Avenue.

Rental apartments in The Heights are generally considered to be located in the area that's bordered to the south by the Bergen Arches rail tracks and The Divided Highway (also known as the Pulaski Skyway, or Route 139); to the east by Palisade Avenue (and the city of Hoboken); to the north by Patte
host_about: I worked on Wall Street for more them twenty-five years, and one of the things I loved the most about my job was the flexibility the company gave me when traveling around the world. We are very friendly and always love to have guests in our apartments. Most of the time we are traveling to new places. We enjoy meeting new people. As an avid traveler, I enjoy providing others with an affordable and comfortable place to stay.  Thank you so much.

neighborhood_overview:
- Not a greatest neighborhood in Jersey City. We are one Light Rail stop off from the most developed/expensive part of JC (and the contrast is quite clear). You will notice graffiti as well as bars covering the windows (but the crime rate is not at all high compared to surrounding area including downtown JC based on public statistics). Some of our guests were not comfortable being in the neighborhood and it took for our family to get used to it.
- The neighborhood could be noisy due to freight railway that passes nearby and a neighbor who plays loud music outside every few Saturday.
- Limited supermarkets and restaurants availability (a few small convenient stores in the neighborhood but, for a decent supermaket, you will have to take light rail to Hudson Greene Market near Exchange Place station.)

neighborhood_overview: Part of the Newport community in Jersey City is the Newport Centre Mall, a large traditional indoor shopping complex anchored by Macy's, JC Penney, Sears and Kohl's. Outside the mall and around the Newport area are a variety of primarily neighborhood oriented restaurants (known collectively as "The Restaurants at Newport") and retail stores (known collectively as "The Newport River Market") including a number of notables such as a Target store which opened in 2004, Staples and Best Buy.

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.91 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Manhattan is 20-30 minutes away by bus or subway! Buses going to Times Square/Port Authority are a 3 minute walk. The Journal Square Path (subway) station is about 15 minutes walking or a quick bus ride away.

Relax and unwind in our comfortable, eclectic six room space after a day of sightseeing. This large apartment occupies the entire 1st floor of a 1910s era home in Jersey City's 'The Heights' neighborhood. The residential area is quiet and safe.

STR21-00050 9/19/2022

The space
Guests have exclusive use of the 1000+ square foot 5-room apartment. The space is decorated in a traditional/transitional style with a blend of modern and vintage furniture as well as several pieces of original art.

We occupy the apartment on the second floor. The Airbnb is on the first floor.

Our Edwardian brick row house was built in the 1910's and has high ceilings, large windows, lathe & plaster walls, original woodwork and ceil
neighborhood_overview:
"The Heights" is a diverse neighborhood in Jersey City. Local grocery, limited restaurant/deli and liquor stores are within a 5-20 minute walk. There are also two urban parks, Pershing Field and Gordon Park, that are a quick walk from the house. Pershing field has playground equipment, tennis courts and other amenities.

Please note "the Heights" is not in the downtown area of Jersey City that borders the Hudson River. The Heights is primarily a residential, rather than commercial, neighborhood. You can reach Jersey City's waterfront via 2 subway stops, Grove Street or Exchange Place or take a taxi there.

The space
This is the ground floor apartment of a private house. It has a private entertainment backyard with covered dining deck with grill. One master bedroom and a second bedroom, both with queen-sized beds, a large bathroom, eat-in kitchen and a large living room with a sofa bed and space for 2 additional cots that will be available upon request, when more that 6 people are renting the apartment. The space is ideal for two couples with kids or a large family.

name: Home in Jersey City · ★4.29 · 1 bedroom · 4 beds · 1 bath
description:
This 1856 year modern gem in historic downtown Jersey City. Private larger backyard and entire house. There are many upgrades mixed with old world charm and contemporary features. This one of a kind historical home is located literally 5 minutes from the heart of Manhattan! Enjoy only minutes to NYC from your doorstep. We are a few blocks away from the PATH train station which runs to NYC 24/7.
***PLEASE NOTE this is a LEGAL Airbnb unit and all stays are at least 29 nights and longer***

The space
You’ll be staying in your own fully-furnished house including WiFi, smart TV, and all utilities (cable TV available by inquiry for additional cost). The floor plan provides an open living space with a fully-equipped kitchen, living room, and bathroom, charming private larger bedroom with office desk and chair. The house is set up just for guests so it can truly feel like your home during your stay and there’s plenty of space to set up your laptop or stretch out on
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

This city is full of history and quaint restaurants and bars that earned it its nickname as “The Wall Street West”. The historic downtown has many million-dollar brownstones and row houses filled with charming historical 1800’s characteristics. Jersey City just recently spent 7 million dollars upgrading its main upscare pedestrian walkway downtown area with all stores and restaurants. A super fast commute to NYC with many restaurants and boutiques: walk to the subway and ride just 5 minutes to NYC World Trade Center.

The house, built in 1856, is located in Downtown Jersey City with a lot to offer: Cafés, Restaurants ( Orale - Mexican cuisine Razza Pizza), Bars (Dullboy, The Ashford), Pharmacies ( CVS, Walgreens, Medly), and just minutes to Hudson River Waterfront Walkway (walk along the water and enjoy stunning views of NYC). Reserve your seat at the Wally Wall, Manhattan Yacht Club's floating clubhouse in the harbor.
host_about:
HI, we are New York Native, Mom and Dad, we have two beautiful children. we love travelling and enjoy nature and community service.

we have been hosting for 5 years and we are blessed to have one more place to offer my returning guests, as well as some new ones.
It was a joy putting this home together and we hope you will love what we did with the place!

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.97 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
A lovely one-bedroom apartment located in the tree lined historic 'Doctor's Row' neighborhood. It is adjacent to Lincoln Park with a Citi Bike station nearby. There is easy access to Manhattan via the Journal Square PATH station. This flat is quiet, sunny, and has a private entrance. Has elegant bathroom and fully equipped kitchen. The bedroom was upgraded with a brand new luxury mattress as of April 2023.

The space
This is a comfortable, sunny, clean and modern flat surrounded by historic detail. The apartment is attached to a 1905 victorian home in the historic 'Doctors Row' section of Jersey City. There is a private entrance on the side of the house, and the unit sits back from the street. Although attached to the house, it is a separate unit and was originally built as a doctor's office as was typical in the neighborhood at the time. The apartment has been impeccably maintained since a recent renovation. Sound insulation was installed with the renovation to e
neighborhood_overview:
Beautiful Lincoln Park is only a half block away and is part of the newly designated historic district. The park boasts river-front views, a 9-hole golf course, tennis courts, bird sanctuary, and a grand fountain recently restored to its original glory (designed by Pierre J. Cheron, it is the world's largest concrete monument!).
There are many great restaurants in Jersey City, along with farmers' markets and easy access to grocery and other shopping. Restaurant recommendations will be provided on your arrival, along with local transportation info and other helpful tips.

name: Condo in Jersey City · ★4.85 · Studio · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
15 min walk to Journal Sq Path. Then it's 15 min to WTC, 25 min to 34th St. Use Citibike or Uber to Path. Uber pool is $3-4 per person to Journal Sq Path.
Located in a historic brownstone building, the studio has a high ceiling, hardwood floors. Living area has a futon; sleeping area has a bed. The neighborhood is safe but not fancy. You can see garbage on the street like NYC. I can't change my location and the cleanliness of the neighborhood. But my cleanliness is five star. So is my value.

The space
A cozy, quiet and spacious nest that you could hide in after a long day in busy Manhattan. Comfortable space, all in one, under a high ceiling. Lots of light if wanted. Antique shutters, faux fireplace. Fridge, small kitchen, microwave oven, gas range stove, dining area, bathroom with a corner shower unit, living quarter with a futon and a big TV. Sleeping quarter is divided from the rest by a bookcase. Kitchen has pots and pans, plates, cups, a coffee make
neighborhood_overview:
This is a cosmopolitan neighborhood. The Journal Square Path Station (Jersey City-Hoboken's subway system that connects us to Manhattan) is only 15 min walking distance away. We are very close to downtown Jersey City where you can find fancy restaurants and bars. Hoboken is also close by. Uber and the Citibike are affordable options to go to the Path Station and downtown, even to Hoboken. This studio is close to Manhattan and offers great value for those venturing into the city. If you are from the suburbs or small cities of the US with no traffic, no crowds, be prepared for big city life. It’s a safe neighborhood. My family and I have lived in this neighborhood for almost two decades. None of my tenants, guests or neighbors have had an issue about safety.
If you want a good value for your money, this is the right place for you!
STREET PARKING: If you are planning to come with a car, you're lucky if you can find a spot on the street. Jersey City is a highly populated city
host_about: I am an avid traveler and love to stay at Airbnb places wherever I go. I’ve been a superhost three months after I started hosting. I pay attention to detail and answer questions right away. My guests’s satisfaction is my priority. Other than hosting, I co-own a travel company. I’m the mother a teen and two cats.

host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

name: Home in Jersey City · ★4.55 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
description:
10 minutes drive to Newark International Airport. 20 minutes to WTC, and 45 minutes to Midtown Manhattan. 3 minutes walk distance to light rail station.
This is a private basement room.
Please note: Light rail and Path Train are NJ transit, separate with NYC Subway.

The space
Private basement room. Private bathrooms and shared kitchen. Private refrigerator.

During your stay
Driveway free parking by permission, easy street free parking around, living area. Cable TV. Private refrigerator.
Extra cost for laundry.

Other things to note
The house is located in Jersey City. The commute system is separated with NYC MTA.
Please understand this is a BUDGET accommodation , and price are extremely competitively for the NYC area. Please have reasonable expectations about what your're getting for the money that you are paying. Recognize that things in the NYC area are more expensive than many parts of the world

I have lived here in Jersey City for about 10 years, and I love it. I am working as an accountant. I start hosting in Airbnb from 2015, and I had great experiences. I love providing service, excising my hospitality skills.

description:
Experience our chic garden-level brownstone, just 15 min from NYC by subway/car. This 1bedroom, child friendly, apt boasts local artwork, exposed brick, contemporary design, Wi-Fi, A/C, 65" TV, Nespresso, workspace and pull out sofa. Enjoy easy access (5 min walk) to the vibrant Pedestrian Plaza featuring restaurants, bars, and nightlife. Hosts are bilingual (English-French). Infant and toddler accessories available upon request. Enjoy the Jersey City & NYC lifestyle in style and comfort.

The space
Located just 15 minutes from New York City by subway or car. This unique gem offers a stylish and comfortable space, perfect for immersing yourself in the vibrant lifestyle of Jersey City and NYC. Our historic 1850's brownstone is situated near the lively Pedestrian Plaza, with a plethora of restaurants, bars, nightlife, and shops within easy reach, ensuring a memorable stay.

The apartment accommodates up to 4 guests, featuring 1 bedroom with a luxurious P
neighborhood_overview: Nestled in a vibrant Jersey City neighborhood, our brownstone apartment offers easy access to New York City, just a 15-minute subway ride or car journey away. The lively Pedestrian Plaza, a 5-minute walk, boasts an array of restaurants, bars, nightlife, and shops. Green spaces, a grocery store, and coffee shops are also within walking distance. With its unique blend of city life, local charm, historic architecture, and diverse culture, this neighborhood provides the perfect base for exploring Jersey City and NYC, all within walking reach

2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, sleeps 5

The space

neighborhood_overview: Leave the busy, hectic commute behind. Once you step inside this plush, brand new modern high rises, the taxing day fades and you can concentrate on all the stunning on-site amenities. Lounge at the resort-style pool, lose your cares at the spa or try a new spirit at the wine room or try out some new dance steps in two chic clubrooms. Run with the family pet at the in-house dog run. Maybe grill at the barbeque. Try a yoga class. Or better yet, unwind in your own sleek, spacious residence filled with state-of-the-art appliances, hardwood floors, quartz countertops, walk-in closets and fully equipped kitchens and travertine tile bathrooms. Central location is accessible to all bus and rail connections. Also, close proximity to local parks and recreation sights. • Fully equipped kitchen • Cable • High speed internet • Laundry  • Dishwasher • Hardwood floors • Quartz countertops • Travertine tile bathrooms • Energy Star Whirlpool appliances
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge.

description:

The space
Your new home is beautifully designed with luxury features including granite kitchen counter tops, hardwood floors & carpeting, walk-in closets, in unit washer/dryer, individual heat/air conditioning and alarm system.

neighborhood_overview: Leave the busy, hectic commute behind. Once you step inside this plush, brand new modern high rises, the taxing day fades and you can concentrate on all the stunning on-site amenities. Lounge at the resort-style pool, lose your cares at the spa or try a new spirit at the wine room or try out some new dance steps in two chic clubrooms. Run with the family pet at the in-house dog run. Maybe grill at the barbeque. Try a yoga class. Or better yet, unwind in your own sleek, spacious residence filled with state-of-the-art appliances, hardwood floors, quartz countertops, walk-in closets and fully equipped kitchens and travertine tile bathrooms. Central location is accessible to all bus and rail connections. Also, close proximity to local parks and recreation sights. • Fully equipped kitchen • Cable • High speed internet • Laundry  • Dishwasher • Hardwood floors • Quartz countertops • Travertine tile bathrooms • Energy Star Whirlpool appliances
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

You’ll love my place located in one of the larger brownstones on one of the nicest blocks in one of the historic districts of Downtown Jersey City. A good vibe & sense of friendliness in the neighborhood & on the street. Downtown has many restaurants, bars, parks & music events. The space is just the right place for a solo adventurer and/or a business traveler. Location is just 3 blocks from PATH at Grove St with 24/7 access to NYC & a short walk to the Hudson River & Liberty State Park.

The space
This is a large brownstone with steps and levels. The room is located on the third floor and the bathroom is located on the second floor. There is a house cat on premises.

Guest access
Private room on the third floor

name: Condo in Jersey City · ★New · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
description: Beautiful fully equipped 2 bedroom apt. This is our home that we will be renting out while we are not using it. Walk to the PATH train  in Journal Square that takes you to NYC in 20 minutes.  Apt. is near the large Lincoln Park. Lots of restaurants, stores and cafes in the area. Second bedroom has a loft bed that can hold a person unto 250LB. The smaller room is equipped with toys if you have kids. Lots of closet space and a work station. Apt. has large TV screen. Shared backyard is accessible.
neighborhood_overview: This is a diverse and family oriented neighborhood. Lincoln Park is an amazing space to run, walk and have a picnic in. Very fun kids playground in the park. Lots of cafes and restaurants in the neighborhood. Grocery store down the street.
host_about: I teach South Asian and Global Literatures at Colgate University

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.56 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
description:
Right outside the Newport train station. Train to NYC (10min) goes both midtown and downtown. A very clean & large furnished bedroom , queen size bed, office desk and office chair, chest of drawers, full length mirror, clothing rack, table lamp with charger sockets. Temp Adjustable AC/Heating Unit. Laundry in Building. Big windows with awesome view of NYC over hudson. Very Quiet Ambience. Extremely safe community with 24 hr security.

The space
***Tip : Check the map for how close underground metro/ path train is to my apartment. You can catch the train in literally 2 minutes minutes

High-rise Building overlooking Hudson (Manhattan skyline view) has 24hour doorman, mail room, laundry room, and wonderful outdoor deck that overlooks the water. Its beautiful trust me

neighborhood_overview:
Modern residences across the 300-acre community, which is home to 15,000 people, feature spacious, light-filled apartments with stunning views of the Manhattan skyline. Residences feature open layouts with hardwood floors, oversized windows, 24-hour doorman services, parking and laundry facilities. Several buildings include a variety of amenities including a rooftop lounge, screening room, fitness center, and children’s playroom.

Along the waterfront, you will find the community’s signature waterfront park, featuring the only urban beach on the Hudson River. In the summer, it also hosts events exclusively for residents, including outdoor movie screenings, live concerts and festivals. And also features eight sleek corporate office towers comprising nearly six million square feet of Class A office space.


There is a supermarket outside the complex (Morton Williams) which is open daily from 6am-12 midnight. Duane Reade is around the corner, and a delicous bubbl

I am a well-rounded person who enjoys the small things in life. Well dressed , open-minded, easygoing and believe that life is about sharing happy hanging out with friends, chatting over dinner, catching a movie or just trying out new things

Who id like to meet ::
Anyone that is friendly, has a sense of humor and likes to have fun, regardless of where you are, how much money you have, what time it is and what you have to do the next day!

name: Serviced apartment in Jersey City · ★4.71 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Posh, state-of-the-art residences in brand new high-rise buildings. Stunning amenities create an easy and relaxing home atmosphere. Whether sight-seeing or working in New York, come home to a quiet residential lifestyle on the outskirts of busy Manhattan. Leave the stress behind and indulge in luxurious living without the city noise and congestion! Convenient to all waterfront and rail connections.

The space
Leave the busy, hectic commute behind. Once you step inside this plush, brand new modern high rises, the taxing day fades and you can concentrate on all the stunning on-site amenities. Lounge at the resort-style pool, lose your cares at the spa or try a new spirit at the wine room or try out some new dance steps in two chic clubrooms. Run with the family pet at the in-house dog run. Maybe grill at the barbeque. Try a yoga class. Or better yet, unwind in your own sleek, spacious residence filled with state-of-the-art appliances, hardwood floors, quartz counter

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
This apartment is professionally managed by Furnished Quarters, the largest independently owned and operated supplier of short-term furnished housing with over 24 years of experience in the industry. The pet-friendly building boasts luxury amenities like a 24-hour attended lobby, full fitness center with a yoga studio, a pool with a sundeck and more. Positioned in an ideal location, the upscale building is directly across from the Grove Street PATH station, taking you into Manhattan in under 20-minutes. The surrounding area of downtown Jersey City is vibrant and historic, with plenty of restaurants, museums, shopping and parks waiting to be explored.

The space
This vibrant one-bedroom is located in a luxury building in the lively Grove Street neighborhood of Jersey City. The apartment features views of Jersey City, stainless steel kitchen appliances, white matte finish kitchen cabinets, cashmere white countertops, gray subway tile backsplash, LED lighting through
neighborhood_overview: Jersey City, located directly across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan, offers the best of both worlds. Experience Jersey City's own culture, character and community, while having the option to commute into NYC in under 30-minutes via the PATH. With its proximity to Manhattan, Jersey City is popular among young professionals working in New York City looking for an alternative to living in one of the five boroughs. Downtown Jersey City, a major historical district, overlooks the Manhattan skyline. The historic neighborhood was once the first destination for immigrants entering through Ellis Island and still remains one of the most diverse areas of New Jersey. You'll find a vast array of food options from Korean, Indian, and Cuban as well as Italian Street Festivals.
host_about: With 10+ years of experience in the hospitality/corporate housing industry - I began working with Furnished Quarters as VP of Global Solutions in 2011. Since then, they have become one of the largest providers of short-term furnished apartments in the U.S. For over 25 years, Furnished Quarters has provided exceptional experiences with passion, reliability, and integrity. With a wide variety of apartments, we have availability wherever you need!

description:
Experience luxury like you never have before in these fantastic Hudson riverfront apartments. Do you fancy a heated outdoor pool and spa with Manhattan views? A modern fitness center, a state-of-the-art theatre room, a clubroom with billiards, and a playroom and playground for the kids? You got it in this tower located a few steps away from the Newport Path station and the best restaurants in the area offering fantastic skyline views. These apartments feature the best upscale finishes like 9 foot ceilings, hardwood floors, tiled kitchens and bathrooms, and fully-equipped kitchens with stainless steel appliances and espresso cabinetry. Pamper yourself and let luxury surround you in your next trip to Jersey City!

The space

neighborhood_overview: Heading into NYC or exploring the NY metro area? This high-rise is conveniently located down the street from the NY Waterway Ferry, the Hudson-Bergen Light Rail, and the PATH train. Getting into the Big Apple has never been easier!

You’ve just found the best of both worlds. Bluebird Suites provides deluxe apartments with fast, free Wi-Fi, a full kitchen, living room and dining area located in 5-star buildings in the heart of the city. neighborhood_overview:
Modern residences across the 300-acre community, which is home to 15,000 people, feature spacious, light-filled apartments with stunning views of the Manhattan skyline. Residences feature open layouts with hardwood floors, oversized windows, 24-hour doorman services, parking and laundry facilities. Several buildings include a variety of amenities including a rooftop lounge, screening room, fitness center, and children’s playroom.

Along the waterfront, you will find the community’s signature waterfront park, featuring the only urban beach on the Hudson River. In the summer, it also hosts events exclusively for residents, including outdoor movie screenings, live concerts and festivals. And also features eight sleek corporate office towers comprising nearly six million square feet of Class A office space.

Our studio is excellent for solo, couples, small family, or business travelers and there's everything you need to make your stay comfortable. We are a 12 minutes car ride to the new American Dream mega mall! By staying with us, you're helping support two Broadway actors to pay their mortgage during these uncertain times. Newly renovated ground floor apartment with backyard access for your furry friends! New Queen sized Performa Sleep mattress. Washer/Dryer in unit. neighborhood_overview:
Great restaurants downtown Jersey City (20 minute walk), cafes and shops are nearby as well. 2 different options for parking: $10/day parking in a driveway near our house or Journal Square Path subway has a big lot, check online for current pricing.

There are also two Citi Bike Stations (Bike sharing program) within 5-7 minutes walk (Jefferson Avenue and Beacon Avenue). Great way to get around and there are stations downtown Jersey City, at Liberty State Park and all over so you can check out everything and not have to worry about parking.

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights, often simply called The Heights, is a pleasant, somewhat densely packed residential neighborhood in the northern section of Jersey City, which in turn is the second largest city in the state of New Jersey.

Homes in the area can be most often found in the two- and three-family detached houses which sit on small lots and which dominate the housing stock here, or in the low-rise apartment buildings that also are a considerable presence in the neighborhood. There are also more than a few stately old Victorian and Edwardian houses scattered throughout the streets of the Heights with rental apartments within, especially on Sherman Place and Summit Avenue.

Rental apartments in The Heights are generally considered to be located in the area that's bordered to the south by the Bergen Arches rail tracks and The Divided Highway (also known as the Pulaski Skyway, or Route 139); to the east by Palisade Avenue (and the city of Hoboken); to the north by Patt

As an avid traveler, I enjoy providing others with an affordable and comfortable place to stay.  Thank you so much.

neighborhood_overview: Jersey City is the second most populous city in the state of New Jersey. Located just across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan, it’s part of the New York metropolitan area. The city’s architecture ranges from Industrial Age homes to classic brownstones to modern high rises. Downtown Jersey City, a major historical district, overlooks the Manhattan skyline. The waterfront section of the city is nicknamed “Wall Street West” for being home to several employers in the financial services, securities and insurance industries. The lofty office buildings, including the highly distinctive Goldman Sachs Tower, create a stunning skyline. With its proximity to Manhattan, Jersey City is popular among young professionals working in New York City looking for an alternative to living in one of the five boroughs. It is also one of the most ethnically diverse cities in the world, with large populations of Hispanic, Asian and Indian Americans. The Port Authority Trans-Hudson (PATH) train, a 24-hour s

neighborhood_overview:
Historic Downtown Jersey City is brimming with activity! With its close proximity to NYC, the area has seen a rapid development in the past 7 years and is now home to a diverse mix of locals, restaurants, bars and businesses. Just take a look on Yelp and you will find over 50 places to eat and drink at that are rated 4 STARS and above, all within a 10 minute walk from the apartment! In addition, there is Newport Mall nearby, which has a lot of shopping options (H&M, Zara, Coach, G-Star, Macys, Footlocker to name a few) a cinema and a diverse food court.

In our opinion, there are only 3 areas in New Jersey that are worth staying in if you are visiting NYC for a vacation or for business. Downtown Jersey City, Historic Jersey City and Hoboken due to their transport links to Manhattan, great local bars and restaurants, and for being known as incredibly safe areas.

Journal Square is still developing and very rough around the edges, with few bars and restaurants to

name: Townhouse in Jersey City · ★4.79 · 4 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2 baths
description:
• Our beautiful & sunny town house is a newly renovated, historic home that dates back to 1900. A 2 min walk from the metro to NYC! 15 minutes to World Trade Center and more! 1 free parking spaces behind the house!

• Perfect for groups visiting JC or NYC. The house has 10 ft. high ceilings, tasteful decor, and a huge skylight.

• Lovely furnished dining room for a cozy dinner and adjoining living room to relax or watch a movie with your company. The house is centrally heated and cooled.

The space
This is a large house is comprised of 4 cozy bedrooms, each with their own efficient storage, an incredibly comfortable space for a discerning traveler.

Spacious common area which includes living and dining space. We offer fast wifi as well as a TV supporting Netflix and Hulu for the guest's relaxation.

Kitchen amenities include, a breakfast bar, microwave, toaster oven, keurig coffee maker with various flavor pods, full size
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is very safe and full of character. The house is located across from the newly built Journal Squared Tower and 2 blocks away from the Jehovah Witness Kingdom Hall in Journal Square. It is actually located in the center of Journal Square. There are numerous grocery stores, bakeries, coffee shops and restaurants steps away. City cafe, Whealth cafe, Rasoi, Emma's,   Star Bucks and the Dunkin' Donuts. You have access to Jersey City's Little India on Newark Avenue, just a few blocks away. Try some local fan fare or take a walk to the PATH station to go downtown or into Manhattan! WE ARE 3 TRAIN STOPS AWAY FROM DOWN TOWN MANHATTAN!!!
host_about: I was born and raised in India where I received my formal education. I am currently a physical therapist and have been practicing for the past 30 years. My beloved husband, Yonel, was born and raised in Haiti. He holds a PhD in public affairs and administration. He has been a full time government employee for the past 29 years and a part time adjunct professor at Rutgers University. We both enjoy the hospitality business and do our best to make our guests feel at home.  In our spare time, we enjoy cooking and gardening with our children.  Please  come stay a while and enjoy our home.

name: Guest suite in Jersey City · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Studio apartment, 1 bath. 1 queen bed, 1 air mattress, small equipped kitchen, walk to subway (Grove PATH) & 7 min ride to NYC. Rates Vary. Charming and cozy!

The space
Private Entry. The unit is below grade yet has good lighting. The building is a 200 year old brick brownstone style dwelling. The air conditioner is a window unit. This is an urban NYC style apartment and not a fancy hotel or a new construction type of environment. If you are looking for a palace experience, please continue looking for a better fit. The apartment is a cozy, clean, and safe home away from home in mixed community. It is a stone's throw from NYC in a vibrant neighborhood with terrific restaurants. This apartment is a good solution for a couple or a family of 3 looking for peace and quiet after being out all day. Sound travels very easily in older houses. My family and I live in the apartment above the studio so you may hear my son's little feet. We do are best to keep the noise level

description:
NOTE: PLEASE READ FULL DESCRIPTION BEFORE CONTACTING, AS MOST QUESTIONS ARE ANSWERED IN THE LISTING. OTHERWISE IF IT'S A QUESTION ALREADY ANSWERED ON HERE, WE WILL KINDLY ASK YOU TO READ THE FULL DESCRIPTION. THANKS IN ADVANCE.

Looking for a homely feel, and want to see what it's like living in the tri state area? This may be a good fit for you. Fully furnished apartment near public transportation and highways. You can check out Hudson county, and be near NYC without paying NYC prices.

The space
One bedroom furnished basement apartment available. It is approximately 550 square feet. There is a private entrance at the back of the house for the basement apartment. We live upstairs in the rest of the house, which is a separate space of its own. Guests have their own area and we have ours.

The apartment has a kitchen, microwave, fridge, and internet included. We also have a coffee-maker, coffee, tea, and water available as part of your stay.
neighborhood_overview:
We live in the Lincoln Park area of Jersey City, in between ST PETER'S UNIVERSITY, And NJCU colleges. We live near West side avenue, and Communipaw avenue.

My part of the block is a little quieter than other parts of the area. Lincoln park is a few blocks away, along with a golf course. If you want to walk or jog in the park, this is a great place to do so. Sundays there is a farmer's market in the park, if you want to check that out.

name: Home in Jersey City · ★4.94 · 3 bedrooms · 9 beds · 2 baths
description:
Our hip urban home is a great base for your family gatherings or City adventures! Gorgeous chef's kitchen, two 55" TVs with speedy WiFi (Netflix, Hulu, etc). Ideal for groups of 6 to 10 (but sleeps up to 16). Vibrant family-friendly neighborhood, a short 20 min. walk to Journal Square PATH station which has buses & trains to NYC, Hoboken and Newark Airport, all within a 10-25 min subway ride. Our family lives in the downstairs attached home. Ask about add’l bed/bath & rented parking space.

The space
We are a local family, not absentee landlords. We live in the attached home below, but your home will have its own private, locked entry and entirely private spaces.

Built over a century ago, our fully-renovated 3 bedroom/2 bath home includes a well-lit Victorian double salon with high ceilings and a spacious attic bonus room (a great hideaway for kids and teenagers— or couples who want a big bed for each to sleep on) where there are two queen beds, a futo
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is a gem with the best view of the Manhattan skyline and a 7 min drive to the Statue of Liberty! Hoboken, home of Carlo's Bakery, is our next door neighbor. Our neighborhood is especially family friendly and walkable. Enjoy tennis, picnicking, bike trails and multiple playgrounds, all within a 3-minute walk from your home away from home. Just around the corner is a Catholic church, an array of ethnic eateries, a Dairy Queen, convenience stores, fruitstands, hair salons, etc.

We are also close to Liberty State Park, where you can catch a ferry to the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, or to NYC!
host_about:
We are the parents of three young adults, and former foster parents; Mike is a professor and Kennan teaches at a cancer hospital in NYC. We consider ourselves to be committed to our community. 
We speak Spanish (though we are rusty).  Kennan can sign (though she is rusty too). But we would love to get some practice. 
We find great joy in hosting people and families from all over the world!

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.90 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Monthly renters welcome.

Rent this tastefully decorated, sun drenched one bedroom urban apartment 40 minutes away from Manhattan. One parking spot on site. Located near light rail train in the bustling Bergen-Lafayette section of Jersey City, this unit features a plush queen bed, an extra air mattress, 49" LED TV, Netflix and WiFi, fully equipped kitchen, walk-in shower, and in-unit laundry. Street parking usually available. You will be steps away from parks and trendy restaurants.

The space
This apartment has been updated to feature a mix of modern design and old-world brick townhouse charm. Everything you need is provided - fresh towels, tissue paper, soaps/shampoo/bodywash, cooking utensils and new appliances. Ground coffee and coffee maker in the kitchen will power your mornings and prepare you for a full day of NYC sightseeing.

Guest access
Enjoy a small gated backyard area in the back of the property. We have great re
neighborhood_overview:
Bergen-Lafayette is an urban neighborhood offering a diverse mix of residents, sights, and activities. This is a decent neighborhood and is generally safe. Please remember you are in Jersey City, not all of its streets are lined with charming brownstones and upscale restaurants. Some blocks, like ours, will give you extra entertainment in the form of the occasional loud boombox or kids playing lively games of hide and seek on the street.

Uber is very popular in Jersey City, and a ride between the apartment and the PATH station at Exchange Place in Downtown won't cost more than $10. They will take a group of 4 people, which means your cost per-person will be lower than the $2.5 light rail ticket. If you haven't used Uber before, let me know and I will send you an invite which comes with a small discount.

description:
Cozy 1 bdrm apt. in a two family house. Safe neighborhood. The apt. features a Queen size bed, WiFi, 65" TV, kitchen,air conditioning, bathroom, and a small living room & COMPLETELY PRIVATE. It is very convenient if you are traveling to NYC for business or pleasure. Is perfect if you want to explore New York City BY PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION. description:
Studio apartment in historic rear building close to 2 ferries and Path train to Manhattan (7 minute walk to the Path, 4 minutes to each of the ferries). Located in a quiet rear building in the historic Paulus Hook neighborhood, this apartment is on the 1st floor (the owners live on the top two floors). The apartment has a full kitchen and wifi, and is entered through a lovely courtyard garden that guests can enjoy in good weather, which has chairs and a picnic table.

The space
The apartment is located in a unique rear building in the middle of a block. It is accessed through the front building, you pass through a hallway and then a garden courtyard to enter the building. The courtyard has a picnic table and chairs to relax when the weather is nice (in the warmer seasons).

Guest access
