name: Condo in Jersey City · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Flexible Check-In! Check out is 11am, flexible check out available for extra $15/hour till 9pm (based on availability). 10-15 minutes to Manhattan! Luxury building. No gym but we have a rock climbing wall not to far away.
5 minute walk to breath-taking city views and ferry to NYC!
Train station is close by and will take you to 34th Street (Penn station) or the World Trade Center.
Many shops and restaurant within walking distance.

The space
One bedroom apartment (800 square feet), chic decorations, with spacious room, sink bathroom, queen size bed.
Please be accurate with the number of people staying over.
We have a full size fridge, dishwasher, oven and stove. I have dish-ware, pots and pans you are welcome to use. Guests do not have washer/dryer access.
Double bunkbed and crib in main room area. Also, have a sofa bed. Bedroom not for guest use.

Guest access
Entire apartment is available.
neighborhood_overview: Very close to Exchange Place and Grove Street PATH stop. Coffee shop and mall close by.
host_about: Hi! I’ve lived in Jersey City, NJ for the last 8 years. It’s a great city and is growing everyday. There are a lot of amazing restaurants and Manhattan is only a 10 minute train ride away. The train can take you to 34th Street (Penn Station) or World Trade Center. I have coffee shops, a mall grocery store, Starbucks, McDonalds, Dunkin Donuts all within walking distance.

name: Home in Jersey City · ★4.68 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
description:
A huge spacious loft 20 x 25 ft. King-sized bed, dorm-sized fridge, WIFI, air-conditioner. Flooded with light from 2 Skylights and three windows. Furnishings are an eclectic mix of period pieces. Work Area; Dining Area: oak dining table and chairs. Cozy Sitting Area: futon sofa. Dressers, Clothes cabinet, bookcases. Kitchen and bathroom are shared. The bathroom is located on the second floor and the loft is located at top floor large Row House. We are in a National Historic district.

The space
The LOFT is a very spacious, quiet, light-filled space within a very large row house located downtown on a lovely tree-lined street

Guest access
Parking is extremely difficult and only available with a permit for locals. However, there are lots of public transportation options: PATH train, light-rail train, local low cost van service.

Other things to note
House cat on premises

name: Condo in Jersey City · ★4.98 · Studio · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Downtown completely renovated 2nd story Historic Brick Condo 3 blocks from PATH subway access (2 stops World Trade and West Village), guaranteed parking 1 block away, 15 min drive to NYC. Perfect for business travelers or visiting couples w/ convenient NYC access, high speed internet access and 32" monitor, printer. You'll love the Jules Verne themed dining area and lavish amenities.

The space
We purchased and renovated the place, gutting the plaster interior and exposing the original 1852 brick to build our fantasy condo. The condo is on the second floor (1 flight of steps) of an apartment building across from City Hall and 3 blocks from downtown Jersey City with upscale restaurants, entertainment and shopping.

description:
Standing 50 stories high & overlooking Manhattan’s skyline, this new luxury tower is a one of a kind location. Inside this fabulous high-rise offering the latest in amenities & services like an outdoor heated pool & spa, a fitness center, a theater room, a playroom, & a sophisticated club room, you will find well appointed apartments with nine foot ceilings, fully-equipped designer kitchens, and hardwood floors. neighborhood_overview:
Why stay in Manhattan when you can savor the peace and quiet of this luxurious Jersey City high-rise? Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Fifth Avenue, this Downtown Jersey City building is a better value than anything you’d find across the Hudson - and you can still get to NYC in minutes via the ferry or the PATH train.

Rest and relax in this peaceful oasis perched on the edge of the river, which features plush mattresses, sophisticated wood furnishings, and spacious closets so you can unpack and stay for a while. In the bathroom, you’ll find masterful tile work and modern fixtures - plus towels and toiletries provided for your convenience.

After a day at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, a matinee show on Broadway, or a packed agenda of meetings, you’re bound to be hungry, Cook up a storm in the full kitchen, which features stainless steel appliances, including a full-size fridge and freezer, an electric stove, an oven, a microwave, and a dishwashe

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 bath
description:
A beautiful private apartment close to NYC in less than 30 minutes, Buses around the corner, located in a quiet and safe neighborhood, near all stores and Restaurants, Kitchen, bathroom tub/shower, Two double bed-size, 12 inches bed/memory foam mattress, recliner chair and comfortable couch in living room

The space
It's cozy and quiet - you will feel at home upon arrival - Private home with three apartments. This listing is for our second floor apartment which is a walk up

Guest access
You have full access to the entire apartment during your stay. The entire Apartment is only for the use of our guests not share with anyone else

Other things to note
There is only Street parking available and needs a visitor parking permit that cost $10 daily Monday through Saturday.
Sunday and Holidays is free.
Please be aware of bus stops signs or private driveways entrance.
We have USB plugs available

This cozy and warm Apt located in a safe neighborhood, on a street full of families and great people. If you are looking for a friendly place to stay while you enjoy the area, we are it! and is close and walking distance to Restaurants and Supermarkets.

Rodrigo & Kenia

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.70 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Spacious, fully furnished one bedroom apartment with private entrance located in the Bergen Hill part of Jersey City which is minutes from Manhattan by train, car or ferry. Free parking is available on the street or in driveway (by request) so perfect for families or small groups looking for quality, comfort and convenient access to the city.

The space
This spacious home away from home is conveniently located in the Berry Hill section of Jersey City. The Garfield light rail station is located around the corner making transportation to NYC and other places a breeze and connects to popular destinations such as Liberty State Park, Statue of Liberty, 9/11 Memorial etc.

Guest access
Guests will have access to the back yard, as well as parking and laundry upon request.
neighborhood_overview: Berry Hill is an up and coming part of Jersey City's Bergen Lafayette area. With Jersey Citys largest municipal park (Berry Lane Park) around the corner with basketball and tennis courts, a doggie park, workout equipment, water park and baseball and football fields the area has a real sense of community. There are also a number of great local restaurants and things to do.

Stay in this charming, Garden Tiny House, a writer’s quaint dream, freshly re-designed and remodeled, while still holding 1900’s character.

Just minutes away from the beautiful Lincoln Park and a walk and a few path train stops away from The West Village and FiDi ( more about that in the Getting Around section )

The space
❤️“We absolutely loved our stay! We booked this for part of our honeymoon & loved it!”
❤️“The place was fantastic for my eleven year old daughter and me. It was exact as the photos shown on the application. It is so nicely decorated, that looks like a fairy tale house.”

Embrace the freedom of minimalistic living in this charming Garden Tiny House. While it has a 250 sq ft surface, it's built in mind with the small footprint principles and feels spacious and sunny. The giant windows offer plenty of natural light and t
neighborhood_overview:
Like the majority of affordable Airbnb listings in Jersey City and Brooklyn, our Tiny House is located in an up and coming neighborhood, further away from the crazy. As it consist of mostly residential houses, it’s quite and friendly. There is a grocery store and a few restaurants a couple of blocks away, and that specific street is in the middle of a gentrification process, but it’s totally safe.
The Lincoln Park around the corner is charming and my personal favorite thing about the neighborhood.
Get away from the busy and noisy Manhattan streets once you’ve enjoyed touristing around and enjoy a walk or morning jog in Lincoln Park! 👟🌳🌸

Street parking is easy to find ( a NYC metro area easy though, please keep that in mind:) )

Getting to NYC is easy peasy!
It takes 25min+ to get to Manhattan, depending on how you decide to get there.

Like driving?
It's about a bit 20 minute drive to get to Manhattan with no traffic.

description:
Located at the Jersey City waterfront with breathtaking views of the Manhattan skyline, these sleek apartments feature spacious, sun-filled floor plans, fully-equipped, gourmet kitchens, and much more. This full lifestyle building offers amenities including a 7th floor terrace with resort-style pool, spa, lounge areas, BBQ grills, double-sided fireplace, and outdoor billiards, a state-of-the-art fitness center with yoga studio, and a children’s indoor playroom.

The space
Your new home is beautifully designed with luxury features including granite kitchen counter tops, hardwood floors & carpeting, walk-in closets, in unit washer/dryer, individual heat/air conditioning and alarm system.

Your fully appointed apartment is furnished with all the necessities of home, including linens and towels.

Property amenities include:

• Controlled access
• Meeting room
• Clubhouse
• Large fitness center with new equipment
• Sun
neighborhood_overview: Leave the busy, hectic commute behind. Once you step inside this plush, brand new modern high rises, the taxing day fades and you can concentrate on all the stunning on-site amenities. Lounge at the resort-style pool, lose your cares at the spa or try a new spirit at the wine room or try out some new dance steps in two chic clubrooms. Run with the family pet at the in-house dog run. Maybe grill at the barbeque. Try a yoga class. Or better yet, unwind in your own sleek, spacious residence filled with state-of-the-art appliances, hardwood floors, quartz countertops, walk-in closets and fully equipped kitchens and travertine tile bathrooms. Central location is accessible to all bus and rail connections. Also, close proximity to local parks and recreation sights. • Fully equipped kitchen • Cable • High speed internet • Laundry  • Dishwasher • Hardwood floors • Quartz countertops • Travertine tile bathrooms • Energy Star Whirlpool appliances
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

name: Condo in Jersey City · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
description:
Situated a 5 minute walk away from the Grove Street PATH (~15min to Manhattan), this 19th century historic apartment is the ideal spot to experience vibrant downtown Jersey City and NYC! This apartment has abundant natural light and offers an open floor plan and modern kitchen. The unit offers free in unit laundry, WiFi , Netflix/HBO Max on a 55" OLED TV, and a landscaped shared backyard with grill and seating. You'll wake up each day refreshed on a new Avocado queen size mattress.

The space
Historic charm (original hardwood floors, plaster moldings, and french pocket doors) meet modern luxuries (55" OLED TV, Wifi, Smart Lights, Espresso machine) in this gorgeous home.

Other things to note
This unit is in a self-managed condominium, meaning that certain upkeep in the building is managed by the renters. It is the responsibility of guests to take trash /recycling to the common receptacles located in front of the building. During winter month
neighborhood_overview: This quaint and vibrant neighborhood offers beautiful architecture, parks, restaurants and bars all steps away from the property!
host_about:
Traveling around the planet and experiencing new cultures and places is a true passion of mine. When I travel, I love to immerse myself in the people and environment. I love learning how to cook new cuisine, explore the outdoors (hiking/kayaking), and visit museums and parks. 

As a guest, I am courteous and treat the home/apartment as my own. I enjoy receiving advice/recommendations from airbnb hosts, so please feel free to let me know what are the must dos/sees in your city!

If you have any questions, please feel free to ask!

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
-Recently-renovated, modern one-bedroom/one-bathroom apartment
-Open concept living area with fully equipped kitchen
-Washer & dryer
-Professionally cleaned between each stay
-Located on a tree-lined street in downtown Jersey City
-PATH train into Manhattan is just a quick walk away!
-2 blocks to Hamilton Park,
-neighborhood has trendy restaurants, bars, coffee shops and grocery stores all within a short walk
-Paid parking is available nearby

The space
Our home is a recently renovated two-family historic wood row house. The home is set back from the street about 50 feet. You have a private entrance to the garden level apartment. The bedroom and living space each have individually remote-controlled heating and A/C units, so you have full control of temperature regulation. There is also a washer/dryer in the apartment. The kitchen has a full-sized refrigerator, range, dishwasher, microwave, drip coffee maker, and basic cooki
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in the historic neighborhood of Hamilton Park in Downtown Jersey City. The apartment is two blocks away from the park, which has tennis courts, a basketball court, a large playground, plenty of tree-shaded grassy areas for a picnic, and a farmers market on Wednesdays from May through November. Newark Avenue, a pedestrian-only street with lots of trendy restaurants and bars, is an 8-minute walk away. The Newport Mall, with plenty of shopping options and a large movie theater, is three blocks away. There are a number of other restaurants, as well as some great ice cream shops and several local coffee shops, within walking distance. There are also two grocery stores located within five blocks of the apartment (ShopRite and Key Food). See "Getting around" for transportation specifics.

description:
Comfortable, clean condo in downtown Jersey City - Sleeps 4.

The space
Railroad style 750 sq. foot apartment boasts exposed brick interior and well-kept common areas. Bedroom in back with queen bed, dressers, mirror and two windows overlooking maintained backyard. Front room has flat screen TV, nice sofa bed, and two windows looking out on neighborhood. Kitchen and dining room sit in between. In-unit washer and dryer included.

Guest access
Guests have entire apartment and full access to backyard with patio space, grill, and fire pit.

Apartment is 30 minutes door-to-door to Wall Street and 45 minutes door-to-door to midtown Manhattan.

Kitchen amenities include, a breakfast bar, microwave, toaster oven, keurig coffee maker with various flavor pods, full size cooking range and
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is very safe and full of character. The house is located across from the newly built Journal Squared Tower and 2 blocks away from the Jehovah Witness Kingdom Hall in Journal Square. It is actually located in the center of Journal Square. There are numerous grocery stores, bakeries, coffee shops and restaurants steps away. Restaurants/ cafe and Bar are within just a few minutes walk, as well as Star Bucks and the Dunkin' Donuts. You have access to Jersey City's Little India on Newark Avenue, just a few blocks away. Try some local flare or take a walk to the PATH station to go downtown or into Manhattan! WE ARE 3 TRAIN STOPS AWAY FROM DOWN TOWN MANHATTAN!!!
host_about: I was born and raised in India where I received my formal education. I am currently a physical therapist and have been practicing for the past 30 years. My beloved husband, Yonel, was born and raised in Haiti. He holds a PhD in public affairs and administration. He has been a full time government employee for the past 29 years and a part time adjunct professor at Rutgers University. We both enjoy the hospitality business and do our best to make our guests feel at home.  In our spare time, we enjoy cooking and gardening with our children.  Please  come stay a while and enjoy our home.

Private room with private bathroom on first floor of the building. Access to backyard, a full laundry room and free WiFi. 5 minute walk to the Journal square Path train and a 10 minute ride to first stop in NYC.

The space
We are a Century’s old Boutique Rooming House that has been renovated. We offer European style rooms with shared bathrooms and Continental styled rooms with private bathrooms. All rooms have microwave ovens, mini refrigerators, desk and chair, an Iron, blow dryer, heat and air conditioning (in the summer and spring), sheets, comforter, towels, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, plastic utensils, plates, bowls, cups, toilet paper and free Wi-Fi. We also have a laundry room for your use (for a fee) on premises and we will provide you with a refillable laundry card.

neighborhood_overview: Magnolia House is just minuets from NYC!! You can take the PATH train to WTC/Financial District/Tribeca, SOHO, Greenwich/ West Village, Meatpacking District (High Line), Chelsea, Flat Iron District, Madison Park, Fashion District & 33rd Street PENN Station.  You can also take the PATH train to explore Jersey City!! We are only two stops from Newport Mall & Exchange Place and not far from Liberty State Park. We are also walking distance to so much in the area! The Magnolia House is located in the perfect area for tourists, travelers, students and professionals.

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.76 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
One of a kind unique 1800’s brownstone with modern amenities located in the heart of downtown jersey city!

Our apt is a 5-8 min walk to the nearest station to get Manhattan. The grocery store is one block away. Restaurants and bars are also a few blocks away. It's a 10 min train ride to lower manhattan and about a 15 minute train ride to midtown.

Don’t hesitate to book with us! We are in compliance with the new JC Airbnb ordinance law. :)

PERMIT NO. STR23-142

The space
Guests are entitled to use the entire space of the apt.

Guest access
Guests can check in at their convenience. There is a lockbox that guests can obtain the apt keys from.

Other things to note
Parking: We highly recommend not having a car during your stay with us since parking can be difficult in our area but if you must have a vehicle we do have street parking available. For street parking you'll need to watch for the
neighborhood_overview: Hamilton park and van Vorst park are both in close proximity and a 5 min walk. Newport mall is also near by with major dept and luxury brand stores. Key Food grocery store is 1 block away. There is also a professional dry cleaners and laundromat.
host_about: I'm an energetic individual that loves Nyc! I also have two beautiful children and a dog who is just as cute as my babies :) During our spare time when I'm not tending to our Airbnb guests I like to take walks by the jersey city water front, taking my kids to the park, eating out in the city, watching movies and traveling when I can!

name: Serviced apartment in Jersey City · ★4.0 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Soaring 50 stories above the Hudson River, this glamorous tower has everything a traveler would need (and more!) for a trip to the NYC metro. Enjoy all the bells and whistles, including:
- Upscale furnishings, tall ceilings, and gourmet kitchens in every unit
- Resort-style building amenities such as an outdoor pool, theater room, gym, and 24/7 concierge
- Light rail steps from the front door and easy access to PATH
- Walkable neighborhood a block from Newport Centre

The space
Why stay in Manhattan when you can savor the peace and quiet of this luxurious Jersey City high-rise? Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Fifth Avenue, this Downtown Jersey City building is a better value than anything you’d find across the Hudson - and you can still get to NYC in minutes via the ferry or the PATH train.

Rest and relax in this peaceful oasis perched on the edge of the river, which features plush mattresses, sophisticated wood f
neighborhood_overview:
Why stay in Manhattan when you can savor the peace and quiet of this luxurious Jersey City high-rise? Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Fifth Avenue, this Downtown Jersey City building is a better value than anything you’d find across the Hudson - and you can still get to NYC in minutes via the ferry or the PATH train.

Rest and relax in this peaceful oasis perched on the edge of the river, which features plush mattresses, sophisticated wood furnishings, and spacious closets so you can unpack and stay for a while. In the bathroom, you’ll find masterful tile work and modern fixtures - plus towels and toiletries provided for your convenience.

After a day at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, a matinee show on Broadway, or a packed agenda of meetings, you’re bound to be hungry, Cook up a storm in the full kitchen, which features stainless steel appliances, including a full-size fridge and freezer, an electric stove, an oven, a microwave, and a dishwashe
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

Very close to JW convention hall.
host_about:
Me and my hubby like to travel all over the world. We come back inspired to create special experiences and spaces that we love sharing with our guests in the NYC outer area.

Mommy of an orange tabby and an adorable dachshund mutt.

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is close to NYC and has a variety of public transportation options. Neighboring Hoboken and downtown Jersey City are both easy 15 minute walks and have plenty of lovely options for dining and entertainment. 20 minutes from Newark airport.

We are 6 miles from MetLife stadium, home to the Giants and Jets. Appr. 15 minutes via Uber or car.

We provide maps and bus/train instructions for NYC travel. The fastest to Herald Square (Macys's) is (a) 16 min walk to PATH at Journal Square, then 20 min train to 33rd street. Or take 3 minute bus to PATH for faster service. PATH drops at Christopher Street, 9th street, 14th street (Union Square), 23rd street and 33rd street (Macy's). There is also a separate Path Service line directly to the World Trade Center (about 10 minutes on the train).

There are also direct buses that get you to Times Square (Port Authority) in about 35 to 45 minutes that pickup directly outside of our street.
host_about: Hello future friends - my husband, Ted, and I love traveling the world. (So much that we have been to Norway, New Orleans, London, Maine, Austin, Nashville, Toronto, Hawaii, Croatia, Venice, Switzerland, South Africa, Alaska, Portland and Napa in recent years.)  I hail from the midwest (Wisconsin) and love ice cream, cheese and the Packers.  Ted is from Brooklyn and knows everything about NYC + he was an MLB baseball player. We live for country music, half marathons and live music.  We hope to see you at our home or yours! Our goal as Airbnb hosts is to give a purely local and delightful home-away-from-home. See you soon!

neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is very safe and family friendly. Like NYC, the neighborhood is cultural diversity. Jersey City has been gentrifying for the last few years.  We have seen an influx of young professionals and families like ourselves move into this beautiful, vibrant city. We have lived in Jersey City for nine years with our three young kids (5,7,9) and Tim's family has been here for 100+ years.

A couple of blocks from us is an elementary school, catholic high school, Saint Peter's University, churches, and the New Jersey National Guard Armory.

There is a grocery store, wine shop, diners/restaurants right around the corner. One of the best bagel places in the NYC/NJ area is just a few blocks away. An amazing local favorite breakfast spot, Cafe Alice is a block from us. Little India, a 15-minute walk away, has some of the best restaurants around and there are plenty of dining options closer to Journal Square.

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights is a beautiful, growing artist community right above Hoboken. This luxury condo is located right in the formal Riverview Arts District and has numerous coffee places, cafes, restaurants, juice bars, and dessert places opening regularly.

Right at the corner on Palisade Avenue are regular private buses into Port Authority, New York City. These buses take about 15-20 minutes, come every few minutes, and are about $3 per person.

Also right at the corner is NJ Transit Buses Route 123 which goes to Port Authority for $4.50, but you must have exact change.

NJ Transit App can be downloaded for routes and fares as well as CityMapper app.

name: Condo in Jersey City · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Spacious one bedroom apartment ideal for a visit to New York City or Jersey City, and for working remotely. There are two separate work spaces, both pictured. It is a fifteen minute walk or short Uber to the Journal Square Path station which has you in New York City’s Christopher Street (West Village) or World Trade Center in 15 minutes. The apartment is also a 20 minute walk to both the Hoboken Waterfront and the Downtown Jersey City neighborhood. With NYC views as well, this place is great!

The space
You will have the entire apartment to yourself: common area, kitchen, bathroom and bedroom. There is also a common outdoor patio and basement laundry if you need to use it. You'll need to bring the building key with you to access these spaces. You must purchase a $20 laundry card to do laundry.
neighborhood_overview: Jersey City Heights is a great neighborhood located on a palisade above Hoboken with Hoboken, Jersey City, and New York City views (the apartment has New York City views).
host_about:
Hello!

My name is Ryan and I am an educator. I lived in Brooklyn and Manhattan for many years and moved to my current apartment in Jersey City four years ago.

I enjoy traveling a lot so when my apartment is available it's usually because I am off on an adventures somewhere else. When I'm home, I am enjoying all that NYC and Jersey City have to offer. 

Jersey City is great! It's pretty much like living in another borough of the city and am super happy here. There is a lot to do in the area and with the Journal Square path close by and NJ transit bus up the block, you can be in the city in 30 minutes door-to-door. I hope you get to enjoy my place!

Ryan

neighborhood_overview:
Check out my guidebook for recommendations!
The Journal Square area is old and gaining ground with occasional classic films playing at the historic Loews Theater across from the Path Station.
•The Mana Contemporary Art Center is around the corner.
•Square 1 Community cafe is 2 doors down serving excellent food and coffees, drinks etc.
•Little India is a block away with shopping, fresh food, butchers and excellent restaurants.
•Convenience stores like the Dollar Store, a liquor store and small ethnic markets are easily available. There are ashrams as well and a yoga studio.
•Grove Street (Path station stop) is chock full of new restaurants that are delicious and now pedestrian in some areas. Shops and nightlife abound if you decide to stay in Jersey City. Jivamukti has an excellent yoga studio there as well.
•Exchange Place (Path station) has a direct ferry to Brookside Place (near WTC and the Oculus).
•Liberty State Park is a short ride away an

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.98 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
description:
Beautifully decorated, spotlessly clean garden level apartment in the best neighborhood in Jersey City. One stop to NYC enjoy both cities. BOOK WITH CONFIDENCE: This airbnb is LEGAL w all permits and inspected by the city for your safety. There are many illegal airbnbs out there don’t let shady hosts ruin your stay. By law host must list active Policy/Permit Number on the listing. As always we guarantee absolutely clean apartment or cleaning fee will be fully refunded.

The space
Apartment is on a garden (ground) level of a historic townhouse with a private entrance that has direct access to your private rear yard from both bedrooms.

Master bedroom (sleeps 2) has a comfortable hybrid (foam + innerspring) mattress queen bed with fresh linens and a nice sized closet.

Second bedroom (sleeps 2) has a bunk bed with sleep inducing 10" memory foam twin size mattresses and an open wardrobe with wide drawers.

For your co
neighborhood_overview:
We love our neighborhood for the perfect balance of walkability, diversity, and livability. Smart travelers already know Downtown Jersey City is closer to Manhattan than 95% of Queens and Brooklyn with considerably less crowds. Plus our mayor is young and progressive and fully legalized airbnb in 2015, unlike NYC where is very much illegal for short term rentals. Our waterfront has one of the most picturesque views of lower Manhattan, New York Harbor and Statue of Liberty.

The apartment is two short blocks away from Hamilton Park surrounded by gorgeous brownstones and 19th century rowhouses, and it is adorned with impressive 100+ year old trees and lush glass within that often serve as gathering place for locals and visitors alike - the park hosts weekly farmers market, seasonal movie screenings, barbecue festivals, tennis and basketball courts, just to name a few.

host_about:
Hi, I'm Miz!

I have lived in the NYC area for 8 years, and have been sharing my space (now spaces!) with guests since 2014. I love hosting!

I grew up in Houston, Texas, went to college in Pennsylvania, and spent time living in Italy, Spain, and Australia before moving to NYC. I currently live in Jersey City.

I am a real estate agent and property manager, and in my spare time I enjoy long walks in the neighborhood, wandering around NYC, all the self-care (massages, facials, yoga), and eating out (plus a good cocktail) with friends. 

I'm an avid traveler and have stayed with friends all over the world. I love to get a local experience when I travel, so I'm happy to provide that for my guests. My partner Mario and I host together, so you may hear or see him as well! 

Any and all questions welcome! I want to make sure you have a great time in Jersey City & NYC.

description:
You'll be staying on the 3rd floor of a 19th-century townhouse in downtown Jersey City. The house is one block from the Newark Avenue pedestrian plaza, with lots of shopping and restaurants nearby. There's an ice cream shop (Torico) across the street. It's a five-minute walk to the Grove Street PATH station, where you can get the train to New York City or Hoboken. Door-to-door time to downtown NYC is about 20 minutes.

Jersey City Short-Term Rental Permit #STR21-00073

The space
The house was built in 1887 and is one of five identical houses at this end of the block. It was converted into a 3-family at some point, probably 1970s or 1980s. This apartment is the third (top) floor. The second floor is a separate Airbnb apartment, look for "Apt 2 in downtown Jersey City home near NYC."

Other things to note
Many would-be guests have sent us inquiries, only to have someone else book the dates they wanted before we could even respond. We
neighborhood_overview: Our house is right in the middle of downtown Jersey City, one block from the Newark Ave pedestrian plaza, a two-block section of the street that closed to traffic. There are many shops and restaurants within a couple of blocks. If you are willing to walk a few more blocks you can reach ShopRite and Newport Mall. Hamilton Park is a 10-minute walk to the north, and to the south is Liberty Park and Liberty Science Center. The neighborhood is safe, and there are usually a lot of people around, so you won’t be alone.

The surrounding neighborhood is working class however within 20 min you can be in downtown Jersey City or Manhattan. host_about:
I am young, 'trendy' (try to be) professional living in New York.  I moved to NY one year ago from London, although I'm originally from Australia. 

My style of Airbnb-hosting is to provide an extremely high standard - the best service and 'space' that I can, so that my guests enjoy themselves to the fullest.  Over the last few years I have had the pleasure of staying in many Airbnb places all around the world; and I have had wonderful experiences.  Now I want to return the favor, I want you to feel like you are in a 5 Star Hotel.   

Briefly about my career... Two years ago I moved out of the 'Start-up field' to start my own business in Real Estate, and haven't looked back since.  

My motto in life is cliche but true: You can get anything you want in your life as long as you put your heart and mind into it, whilst at the same time having a strong sense of integrity.

The space
I understand that you may have concerns about staying in someone else's home.  I want to assure you that our home will be a safe space for you to enjoy. The 2nd floor bedroom and bathroom are completely private.  
The front entrance is shared by me, my husband, our tenant (who lives on the 3rd floor in a self-contained apartment), and our Airbnb guests. neighborhood_overview:
We love the Paulus Hook neighborhood. We are five blocks from the Hudson River! The Freedom Tower in lower Manhattan is visible to the east as you stand in front of our house. There are convenient coffee and breakfast places just a couple of blocks away. I highly recommend the Light Horse Tavern, Amelia's, Taqueria, and Sam a.m. (for breakfast), four of many great restaurants within a few blocks of our house.

Practically anything you want is really less than a 15 minute walk away! More excellent restaurants for foodies, specialty grocery stores, bakeries, live music, etc. I'm happy to provide recommendations for any activity or shopping need you may have.

neighborhood_overview:
Guests will be located close to everything in a very safe neighborhood. The area is very unique where you can encounter very cool findings (Restaurants, coffee shops, vintage stores, etc.) You'll be located two blocks away from the Palisade Ave. & Prospect St. bus stops, where you will be able to easily take buses to many tourists attractions.

Jersey City Heights is a residential neighborhood with some Victorian and Edwardian homes, The Heights has multicultural restaurants, cafes, and ice cream shops along Central Avenue. Adjacent to a large reservoir, Pershing Field features an indoor skating rink and swimming pool, while Leonard Gordon Park is known for its early-1900s buffalo and bears statues by sculptor Solon Borglum. Washington Park offers sports courts and a playground.

Small town feel in the up and coming Jersey City Heights.

Minutes away, you can walk to Washington Park in Union City. It is a large park with many activities for families or to take a romantic stroll to the cliffs where you can take in the view of the city. 10 minutes from Washington Park you can walk to Hoboken or The River-view Fisk Park where they finished a gazebo which has the most panoramic view of the City you could imagine.

Since I live seconds away from a major boulevard, it is simple to get to the Port Authority/Time Square ($3.75 - Jitney Bus) or World Trade Center! If you do not travel during rush hour, it only takes between 25 to 30 minutes to reach the heart of the city! With rush hour, it only adds an additional 15 minutes tops.

The MTA card you purchase in New York does not work with the buses in New Jersey (different states, so they do not share their money)

I am also steps away from many restaurants, D&D, coffee houses,

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights, often simply called The Heights, is a pleasant, somewhat densely packed residential neighborhood in the northern section of Jersey City, which in turn is the second largest city in the state of New Jersey.

Homes in the area can be most often found in the two- and three-family detached houses which sit on small lots and which dominate the housing stock here, or in the low-rise apartment buildings that also are a considerable presence in the neighborhood. There are also more than a few stately old Victorian and Edwardian houses scattered throughout the streets of the Heights with rental apartments within, especially on Sherman Place and Summit Avenue.

Rental apartments in The Heights are generally considered to be located in the area that's bordered to the south by the Bergen Arches rail tracks and The Divided Highway (also known as the Pulaski Skyway, or Route 139); to the east by Palisade Avenue (and the city of Hoboken); to the north by Patt
host_about: I worked on Wall Street for more them twenty-five years, and one of the things I loved the most about my job was the flexibility the company gave me when traveling around the world. We are very friendly and always love to have guests in our apartments. Most of the time we are traveling to new places. We enjoy meeting new people. Our home is blessed with 5 generations.
It was built in the early 1900's and purchased in 1957 by my grandfather for $7,000. 
Today, our family still lives here with so many great memories.
It's a 2 family house and we've established a very warm and wonderful experience welcoming outstanding guests to enjoy our first floor apartment with a sense of heritage and pride.
Most Sincerely,
Patricia and family

host_about:
I am young, 'trendy' (try to be) professional living in New York.  I moved to NY one year ago from London, although I'm originally from Australia. 

My style of Airbnb-hosting is to provide an extremely high standard - the best service and 'space' that I can, so that my guests enjoy themselves to the fullest.  Over the last few years I have had the pleasure of staying in many Airbnb places all around the world; and I have had wonderful experiences.  Now I want to return the favor, I want you to feel like you are in a 5 Star Hotel.   

Briefly about my career... Two years ago I moved out of the 'Start-up field' to start my own business in Real Estate, and haven't looked back since.  

My motto in life is cliche but true: You can get anything you want in your life as long as you put your heart and mind into it, whilst at the same time having a strong sense of integrity.

description:
Welcome to The Alana, a newly renovated flat in the bustling Bergen Lafayette section of Jersey City. Filled with natural light, this tastefully furnished space features two floors, 4 bedrooms / 2 baths, a fully equipped kitchen, and in-unit washer and dryer. Travel to Manhattan via PATH trains, reachable by Uber or via the Light Rail two blocks away - total trip time will be 30-40 minutes.

Monthly renters welome.

The space
The Alana is a duplex apartment located on the second floor of a two family charming row house in the heart of Jersey City. Groups and families will be comfortable here with enough beds for seven people and two full bathrooms featuring luxurious walk-in showers. All necessities will be provided - towels, bedding, upscale toiletries, hair dryers, iron / board, first aid kit, and more. Check in is a breeze with secure electronic locks. We are always reachable in case you have any questions or requests. Please note the house is equ
neighborhood_overview:
While the majority of our guests come to see NYC, we urge you to explore Jersey City’s beautiful Bergen Lafayette as well. Within 10 minutes of the apartment you will find an array of hip new restaurants, bars, and cafes located on the evolving Communipaw Avenue. Grind Coffee Shop is a must if you are a coffee fan. Three blocks from the house is the new Berry Lane Park - host to regular soccer matches and tennis games. Don’t forget to visit Downtown Jersey City for local gems like Torico Ice Cream Shop and Taqueria Downtown.

Bergen-Lafayette is an urban neighborhood offering a diverse mix of residents, sights, and activities. This is a decent neighborhood and is generally safe. Please remember you are in Jersey City, not all of its streets are lined with charming brownstones and upscale restaurants. Some blocks, like ours, will give you extra entertainment in the form of the occasional loud boombox or kids playing lively games of hide and seek on the street.

neighborhood_overview: Just across the river from Manhattan, Jersey City is considered the sixth borough of New York City. host_about:
Hi, I'm Miz!

I have lived in the NYC area for 8 years, and have been sharing my space (now spaces!) with guests since 2014. I love hosting!

I grew up in Houston, Texas, went to college in Pennsylvania, and spent time living in Italy, Spain, and Australia before moving to NYC. I currently live in Jersey City.

I am a real estate agent and property manager, and in my spare time I enjoy long walks in the neighborhood, wandering around NYC, all the self-care (massages, facials, yoga), and eating out (plus a good cocktail) with friends. 

I'm an avid traveler and have stayed with friends all over the world. I love to get a local experience when I travel, so I'm happy to provide that for my guests. My partner Mario and I host together, so you may hear or see him as well! 

Any and all questions welcome! I want to make sure you have a great time in Jersey City & NYC.

The space
The room is thoughtfully designed for maximum guest comfort in their home away from home. Guests may enjoy Keurig, toaster, and microwave for quick meal prep. neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is the 6th borough of NYC and super convenient to Manhattan. The house is two blocks away from Central Ave. This is a street full of cheap shopping, restaurants, coffee shops all along the sidewalk. You also will catch the bus to Port Authority in NYC here.

There is also Riverview Park park located four blocks away on 498 Palisade Ave. If you want to go for a scenic walk definitely include this! There a farmers market at Riverview Park which is held every Sunday (rain or shine) from the first Sunday in May through the Sunday before Thanksgiving in November, from 10 am to 3 pm.

Hi, I'm Miz!

I have lived in the NYC area for 8 years, and have been sharing my space (now spaces!) with guests since 2014. I love hosting!

I grew up in Houston, Texas, went to college in Pennsylvania, and spent time living in Italy, Spain, and Australia before moving to NYC. I currently live in Jersey City.

I am a real estate agent and property manager, and in my spare time I enjoy long walks in the neighborhood, wandering around NYC, all the self-care (massages, facials, yoga), and eating out (plus a good cocktail) with friends. 

I'm an avid traveler and have stayed with friends all over the world. I love to get a local experience when I travel, so I'm happy to provide that for my guests. My partner Mario and I host together, so you may hear or see him as well! 

Any and all questions welcome! I want to make sure you have a great time in Jersey City & NYC.

Located in a safe, quiet residential street, it is a perfect place to relax after a day in the city. The space
We lovingly renovated our two family home and live upstairs.

Liberty Suite is a beautiful custom designed space that feels like checking into a luxury hotel suite with a fully functioning kitchen. The kitchen peninsula offers 3 unique wood stools to enjoy breakfast or dinner. The bedroom has a full sized bed -sleeps 2-with luxury linens, a spacious closet, 50” tv, shelving, full length mirror, digital clock, shades and sheers. The living room offers a full sized modern sleeper sofa that can sleep 2, coffee table, additional
neighborhood_overview: Bergen Lafayette is Jersey City’s coolest neighborhood for diversity, inclusiveness, restaurants, bars, cafes, etc. Affectionately known as “Bela” the area is open to people from all walks of life, dog friendly, walkable to parks, to downtown JC, to light rails for quick commute. Into fitness? Great run in the park, play basketball around the corner and visit many of the local gyms. For traveling nurses multiple hospitals within 5min-30min away
host_about:
We love diversity, culture, art, creatives.  We can't live without good food, music, warm weather, and a beach/pool. Favorite travel destinations so far Dubai, Greece, Mexico (Tulum), Colombia & South Africa.  We typically travel together but love when friends join.  No matter where or with who #1 is cleanliness  #2 access and security (safe area) #3 high speed internet, wifi, bluetooth etc. and #4 location to transportation, shopping, dining and nightlife. 

So as Airbnb Host we want to provide a great experience for solo travelers, couples and groups alike! We look forward to hosting and welcoming all guest in our hometown of Jersey City! 

The Liberty Suite Team

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.83 · 3 bedrooms · 5 beds · 1 bath
description:
Located conveniently between Newark Airport and NYC this private apartment is perfect for out of town visitors. Walk to the train station in 10 minutes and a 15 minute ride will deliver you to the World Trade Center Oculus. The apartment is a stylishly designed and comfortable place to stay after a long day of exploring NYC or Jersey City!

The space
This is private apartment with dedicated entrance. Apartment is located on the third floor. The entire apt is yours to enjoy.

Guest access
You will have one parking space on the driveway -- closer towards the stairs.

Coin operated washer and dryer is located on the ground floor
neighborhood_overview:
This is a very safe cosmopolitan neighborhood with a lot of development happening. Lots of dining options within walking distance on Central Ave.

We are very close to downtown Jersey City where you can find fancy restaurants and bars. Hoboken is also close by. Uber and the Citibike are affordable options to go to the Path Station and downtown, even to Hoboken. This apartment is close to Manhattan and offers great value for those venturing into the city.
Nearby landmarks
Meatpacking District 1.1 mi
Charging Bull 1.1 mi
Statue of Liberty National Monument 1.4 mi
Century 21 1.4 mi
World Trade Center 1.4 mi

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
description:
Two bedroom Two bathroom apartment in Jersey City Heights very close to NYC attractions (Times Square) as well as Hoboken, Jersey City Downtown Right next to JFK Boulevard and Lincoln street, the center of Jersey City Heights. it is also close to Journal Square (Train to NYC). in 20-25 minutes you will be in Times Square using a shuttle bus right next to the apartment. there is a bus every 3-5 minutes

The space
Easy commute to NYC Times Square and Journal Square.
Safe neighborhood, great for families with kids or large groups of friends

host_about:
The Local Stay, founded in 2008 to make the process of renting furnished short- and long-term apartments absolutely transparent, so renters and property owners alike can rest easy.
At The Local Stay, our goal is to take the guess work out of it, carefully curating apartments so that travelers experience the true pulse of the city. And, since each property owner is personally vetted by The Local Stay team, travelers can rest assured that their stays will be safe and secure. Better vetting means that travelers get the most exclusive apartments in the most central locations, while greater involvement by The Local Stay means that property owners can list it and leave it as we handle communication with renters.
Today, The Local Stay offers hundreds of short-term and long-term rental properties in Amsterdam, Barcelona, Buenos Aires, London, New York, New-Jersey, Paris, Rome, Tel Aviv and more.... Our apartments inventory includes both corporate apartments and privately owned flats, making The Local Stay the perfect option for business travelers, corporate relocation clients and those on sabbatical, as well as foreign students and families on holiday. With options for everyone, The Local Stay provides personalized service so that every traveler can stay like a local.

name: Serviced apartment in Jersey City · ★4.70 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Soaring 50 stories above the Hudson River, this glamorous tower has everything a traveler would need (and more!) for a trip to the NYC metro. Enjoy all the bells and whistles, including:
Upscale furnishings, tall ceilings, and gourmet kitchens in every unit
Resort-style building amenities such as an outdoor pool, theater room, gym, and 24/7 concierge
Light rail steps from the front door and easy access to PATH
Walkable neighborhood a block from Newport Centre

The space
Why stay in Manhattan when you can savor the peace and quiet of this luxurious Jersey City high-rise? Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Fifth Avenue, this Downtown Jersey City building is a better value than anything you’d find across the Hudson - and you can still get to NYC in minutes via the ferry or the PATH train.

Rest and relax in this peaceful oasis perched on the edge of the river, which features plush mattresses, sophisticated wood furnishin

Rest and relax in this peaceful oasis perched on the edge of the river, which features plush mattresses, sophisticated wood furnishings, and spacious closets so you can unpack and stay for a while. In the bathroom, you’ll find masterful tile work and modern fixtures - plus towels and toiletries provided for your convenience.

Upscale furnishings, tall ceilings, and gourmet kitchens in every unit

Walkable neighborhood a block from Newport Centre

description:
15 Minutes to NYC and Hoboken

Beautiful luxury condominium with 2 Beds and 2 Baths, patio, and lots of extras. You will have private access to the entire unit for your stay.

SmartHome upgrades - have fun while relaxing at home and speaking directly to your TVs.

The space
This luxury condominium was once the highest price per square foot in the history of Jersey City Heights.

Highlights:
- Full 4 Zone Audio System - Even Patio

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights is a beautiful, growing artist community right above Hoboken. This luxury condo is located right in the formal Riverview Arts District and has numerous coffee places, cafes, restaurants, juice bars, and dessert places opening regularly.

Right at the corner on Palisade Avenue are regular private buses into Port Authority, New York City. These buses take about 15-20 minutes, come every few minutes, and are about $3 per person.

Also right at the corner is NJ Transit Buses Route 123 which goes to Port Authority for $4.50, but you must have exact change.

NJ Transit App can be downloaded for routes and fares as well as CityMapper app.

A few blocks to Franklin Street and there will be new stairs to the 2nd Street Light Rail Station in Hoboken, you can take the rail to the path or ferry and get to Downtown or Midtown Manhattan. This makes for a possibly nicer trip, plus the benefits of access to the entire Gold Coast of New

description:
This cozy ground floor apartment is under our historic house more than 100 years old. It has unique features. Apartment has everything you may need. Two guests can stay in the bedroom either on two separate twin beds or the connected kingsize bed. Third person can stay on the sofa bed in the living room. Living room and eat-in-kitchen are all the same area in the front. Entrance is private so is the apartment only for you. Hosts live upstairs to help you anytime you need. Very comfy apt.

If you are very sensitive to noise this may not be the right place for you. There's minor noise coming from the street and our foot steps from upstairs but never too early or too late. We provide ear plugs.

Guest access
This is a private apartment with a private entrance. You can also use the front yard to relax at the end of the day. There are chairs right in front of your windows.

neighborhood_overview:
Historic neighborhood with great neighbors. Safe and beautiful neighborhood.
In summer street noise may increase due to firecrackers and music playing cars.

So beware! It's better not to come with a car. If you find parking on the street, during the week, you need to be careful about street cleaning days and hours where you park.

neighborhood_overview: Journal Square is an eclectic and diverse neighborhood with quick access to Manhattan.  Visitors can see signs of its past as a pre-war entertainment district, and even a few landmarks dating back to its start as a Dutch colonial settlement at Bergen Square.  Jersey City is a well-integrated part of the bustling NYC metro area, but retains a proud identity of its own, showcasing incredible food and a thriving urban art scene.
host_about: We are architects that lived in Manhattan before coming to Jersey City.  We’re passionate about cities and traveling, and are excited to host guests to the metropolis that we love and call home.  We’re happy to share our recommendations on what to see and do when you come to New York City, especially architectural sites.

neighborhood_overview:
Located just across the Hudson River from New York City, some refer to Jersey City as the sixth borough. Overlooking Hoboken and the Manhattan skyline, Jersey City Heights is a go-to spot for tourists.
Due to its location, one hundred feet above sea level on the western side of the Hudson River, residents get to enjoy beautiful scenic views of the Manhattan skyline from one side and beautiful marshes and meadowlands on the other side. Variety of public transportation options like the PATH Train, New Jersey Transit’s  Light Rail, and public buses make your traveling to New York City, downtown Jersey City, or Hoboken quick and convenient. Take the stairs off Paterson Plank Road to Hoboken’s 2nd Street Light Rail Station or the elevator at Congress Street to the 9th Street Light Rail Station to easily commute around Hoboken, Weehawken, Jersey City, Bayonne and beyond! New Jersey Transit bus routes also serve this neighborhood, with several major lines to help you zip around locally

host_about:
Hi, I'm an IT professional always learning about the latest trends related to digital technology or listening to some personal development audios. During my free time, I am either building a website or playing with my son.  I love playing ping pong and walking during my free time, which I hope I could do more of. 

I'm originally from India and now in the US for more than 15 years. My favorite food is Indian biryani, cream cheese bagels, pizzas, and Mediterranean food. As you can see nothing extraordinary as I belong to the tribe that thinks we need to eat to live and not live to eat :). 

As a host, I love meeting new people from various cultures, and backgrounds and feel good to know that I have helped them in some small way to have a pleasant and memorable trip. I have visited a number of places in the US, Singapore, and India and know quite well how stressful it can be. I hope to see Europe, Africa, Australia, and the Middle East in the near future. 

I look forward to helping you have a pleasant and safe stay so you can meet your travel goals, be it personal or business.

description:
Welcome to my home!

Just 15 steps away from the one bedroom apartment and you get the bus that takes around 15 minutes to Time Square!!! Newark Airport is a 20 minute drive away. A 5 minute walk away is the Lightrail to get around Jersey City. There is street parking but you should get a $5 daily permit for M-F and be mindful of street signs.

The semi-basement apartment has keyless entry.

The space
The private one bedroom apartment (approximately 600 square feet total and located on the semi-basement floor) gives you the warm feeling of a home away from home while on vacation. The backyard is great to relax or have a bbq. The apartment is completely private and you have exclusive use of the entire bottom floor and a private part of the backyard. As for added bonuses, I provide a Keurig machine and blackout curtains throughout the apartment. I provide the following to name a few: towels, shower gel, shampoo, conditioner, toiler paper, blow
neighborhood_overview: My area of Jersey City is very vibrant, eclectic and diverse, with nice cafes and restaurants and it is safe. Some of my favorite local spots are within a couple of blocks of the apartment. Corto restaurant is a favorite and has a farm to table menu, outdoor seating in the backyard and it is BYOB. Fox and Crow is a nice burger spot that has a parlor in the backroom where you can enjoy live music Thursday through Sunday. Also, Riverview Park, just one block away, provides great views of Manhattan, especially at night.  Let’s not forget about the city of Hoboken which is a 3 minute walk from the apartment.

description:
Waterfront two bedroom apartment with views to the Hudson River and Manhattan Skyline (including the Empire State).

6 minutes walking to the Newport Path Station, 15 mins by train from Manhattan, 3 minutes walking to the supermarket, 5 to the mall (tax free for clothes in NJ) and 7 minutes to the Grove Path Station.

The space
This is our home. We live and work in NYC. You will be able to enjoy the comfort of our cozy, modern apartment just as we live it every day.

Guest access
You can enjoy all the apartment during your stay.
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is where you want to be to enjoy all the excitement of NYC and arrive to a quiet neighborhood to enjoy a good movie or book, a cup of tea or a glass of wine while watching the spectacular skyline of Manhattan.

Jersey City is modern and friendly. Full of coffee, bars, restaurants, and one step to the paths, supermarkets and a mall.
host_about:
We met during a College Program experience working at Walt Disney World. After living in different countries across the globe, we decided to buy a second home in one of the most special places for us, somewhere we always returned to no matter where we were: Florida.

We realized that one of the things we enjoyed the most about Disney (and Universal as well) is the experience, the transportation to other worlds that help us to disconnect from our routine. With that in mind, we created an experience out of our house, adding personal touches, hand-selected decoration and a personality to each room. After finishing our project, we realized that it was something we wanted to share with people that like us, came to Florida for the overall experience.

We have been Airbnb hosts in London, Mexico City, NYC and Lisbon. We have stayed in many cities more and we have met amazing people on this community. We hope we can share our house with equally great people that will enjoy and take care of our home as their own.

We will be happy to connect, share city and park tips, our experience or anything else that will make your stay more enjoyable!

The Local Stay, founded in 2008 to make the process of renting furnished short- and long-term apartments absolutely transparent, so renters and property owners alike can rest easy.
At The Local Stay, our goal is to take the guess work out of it, carefully curating apartments so that travelers experience the true pulse of the city. And, since each property owner is personally vetted by The Local Stay team, travelers can rest assured that their stays will be safe and secure. Better vetting means that travelers get the most exclusive apartments in the most central locations, while greater involvement by The Local Stay means that property owners can list it and leave it as we handle communication with renters.
Today, The Local Stay offers hundreds of short-term and long-term rental properties in Amsterdam, Barcelona, Buenos Aires, London, New York, New-Jersey, Paris, Rome, Tel Aviv and more.... Our apartments inventory includes both corporate apartments and privately owned flats, making The Local Stay the perfect option for business travelers, corporate relocation clients and those on sabbatical, as well as foreign students and families on holiday. With options for everyone, The Local Stay provides personalized service so that every traveler can stay like a local.

description:
Soak in the sun rays from this bright, quaint flat only minutes from the train to NYC. When the shades are up, the sun is not the only sight to see, out the kitchen window you can clearly see the World Trade Center across the water in NYC!

Don't like sun waking you in the morning, close those shades and get a great sleep on this queen bed.

The space
The perfect home for a couple or small family. I used to live in this apartment myself, I have to many clothes and sneakers so want once was cozy became claustrophobic to live in.

The space
Why stay in Manhattan when you can savor the peace and quiet of this luxurious Jersey City high-rise? Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Fifth Avenue, this Downtown Jersey City building is a better value than anything you’d find across the Hudson - and you can still get to NYC in minutes via the ferry or the PATH train.

Rest and relax in this peaceful oasis perched on the edge of the river, which features plush mattresses, sophisticated wood f
neighborhood_overview:
Why stay in Manhattan when you can savor the peace and quiet of this luxurious Jersey City high-rise? Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Fifth Avenue, this Downtown Jersey City building is a better value than anything you’d find across the Hudson - and you can still get to NYC in minutes via the ferry or the PATH train.

Rest and relax in this peaceful oasis perched on the edge of the river, which features plush mattresses, sophisticated wood furnishings, and spacious closets so you can unpack and stay for a while. In the bathroom, you’ll find masterful tile work and modern fixtures - plus towels and toiletries provided for your convenience.

After a day at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, a matinee show on Broadway, or a packed agenda of meetings, you’re bound to be hungry, Cook up a storm in the full kitchen, which features stainless steel appliances, including a full-size fridge and freezer, an electric stove, an oven, a microwave, and a dishwashe
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.87 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
I was a 80s baby and I am excited to share this decorated place with our guests who wants to stay at this themed vacation home :)

The space
Guests has private entry and has 100% privacy during staying. Perfect for romantic couple stay, business trip, or small family staying.

This unique space features:

- 75” LG smart TV
- Spacious and airy bedroom with nice balcony and Queen bed
- Comfortable twin size roller bed for 3rd guest
- complimentary tea and coffee
- reserved parking in driveway for $10/day

Smoking is prohibited at the balcony.

Starting last week of July 2023, we are welcome a new born to our family, please do expect periodically baby crying. We will do our best to minimize the crying during your stay, but a baby cries whenever he wants to cry, and we can only react to it. So we just want to be transparent with this potential noise issue in case you are expecting super quiet stay.

name: Bed and breakfast in Jersey City · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
description:
The house is two short blocks from the Light Rail (Richard Street Stop) which goes to Hoboken Terminal then a short walk to the PATH (Port Authority Trans Hudson) train into the City. About a 30 minute trip if lucky with the timing! The house has a nice view and a comfortable back yard. As an alternate you can walk 15/20 minutes to the Port Liberte ferry to Bowling Green. I have a Steinway grand (in tune!) and often cook dinner which you'd be welcome to join if you want.

The space
The place is comfortable and clean. I have Netflix and Amazon.

During your stay
I will quite often be around as I'm now retired. Children have all left (wife died). I will always be here when you arrive. I will always confirm any booking by e-mail. No email? Means I didn't get the booking

host_about: Easy going transplanted British man - divorced father of three. Love having people to stay.

Stay in style in the Hoboken neighborhood where Frank Sinatra grew up and made his singing debut at a church supper! The space
Get ready for an amazing stay at The Walk Up - the newest 5-story gem in a peaceful Hoboken neighborhood. With hardwood floors, sleek cabinetry, and stunning marble bathrooms, our furnished apartment is a treat for families, business travelers, and digital nomads alike!

Located just a stone's throw from Hoboken's bustling downtown district, you can enjoy all the conveniences of top-notch restaurants, shops, and transportation without the chaos. Plus, th
neighborhood_overview:
Just one-square-mile (2.5 square kilometers) in size, Hoboken is a small town with everything you love about city life. Washington Street is the main thoroughfare, lined with great restaurants, bars bistro-pubs and rooftop bars. Spend an afternoon exploring quaint cobblestone streets, where you’ll find one-of-a-kind boutiques.

Take in the stunning views of NYC as you bike or stroll along the Hudson River Waterfront Walkway, visiting parks and piers on with way. Join the free yoga class at Pier A or settle in for a movie under the stars at Pier 13 Park. Throughout the year, Hoboken hosts a wide range of concerts and a full schedule of festivals celebrating the arts and food—from Restaurant Week to The Mutz (Mozzarella) Festival. There’s a youthful energy here that’s infectious.
host_about: I love to live life.  Take this moment to experience a different place, a different outlook and experience the here and now! Be present and don't wait to live the life you want!

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
This apartment is professionally managed by Furnished Quarters, the largest independently owned and operated supplier of short-term furnished housing with over 24 years of experience in the industry. The pet-friendly building boasts luxury amenities like a 24-hour attended lobby, full fitness center with a yoga studio, a pool with a sundeck and more. Positioned in an ideal location, the upscale building is directly across from the Grove Street PATH station, taking you into Manhattan in under 20-minutes. The surrounding area of downtown Jersey City is vibrant and historic, with plenty of restaurants, museums, shopping and parks waiting to be explored.

The space
This vibrant one-bedroom is located in a luxury building in the lively Grove Street neighborhood of Jersey City. The apartment features views of Jersey City, stainless steel kitchen appliances, white matte finish kitchen cabinets, cashmere white countertops, gray subway tile backsplash, LED lighting through
neighborhood_overview: Jersey City, located directly across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan, offers the best of both worlds. Experience Jersey City's own culture, character and community, while having the option to commute into NYC in under 30-minutes via the PATH. With its proximity to Manhattan, Jersey City is popular among young professionals working in New York City looking for an alternative to living in one of the five boroughs. Downtown Jersey City, a major historical district, overlooks the Manhattan skyline. The historic neighborhood was once the first destination for immigrants entering through Ellis Island and still remains one of the most diverse areas of New Jersey. You'll find a vast array of food options from Korean, Indian, and Cuban as well as Italian Street Festivals.
host_about: With 10+ years of experience in the hospitality/corporate housing industry - I began working with Furnished Quarters as VP of Global Solutions in 2011. Since then, they have become one of the largest providers of short-term furnished apartments in the U.S. For over 25 years, Furnished Quarters has provided exceptional experiences with passion, reliability, and integrity. With a wide variety of apartments, we have availability wherever you need!
