name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.83 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
description:
Discover your new home in Jersey City! Our modern furnished 2BR apartment is just minutes from McGinley Square on a peaceful street. Relax in 1,000 sq ft of living space with a fully stocked kitchen, perfect for cooking up a storm and a dining area for family meals. In the living room you'll find a 65 inch cable TV perfect for movie nights or binge watching your favorites. Both BRs with cable TVs, one an outdoor deck. Enjoy modern comforts and tranquility in this gem of an apartment.

The space
The 2-bedroom flat has 1000 square feet (94 square meters) of space, including a living room, dining room and full kitchen—perfect for a family, a few friends or business travelers searching for a quiet workzone. If the weather is nice, why not kick back on the outdoor patio for some fresh air? As dusk falls, you can relax under twinkling patio lights surrounded by glittering Jersey City high-rises. Our guest services manager will meet you at the apartment and be on cal
neighborhood_overview:
McGinley Square is a vibrant neighborhood located in the heart of Jersey City, just a short distance from Manhattan. This bustling area boasts a diverse community with a rich history, offering visitors a unique blend of urban and suburban living. Here, you'll find a variety of restaurants, bars, and shops, along with easy access to transportation options like the PATH train from nearby Journal Square and bus lines throughout the area.

The square itself is at the intersection of two of the city's major thoroughfares, Montgomery Street, and Bergen Avenue. The area was named after Monsignor Roger McGinley, the builder of St. Aedans Church.

The neighborhood is home to several parks, including Lincoln Park, which features playgrounds, sports fields, and a public golf course. The Hudson River waterfront is just a short distance away, offering stunning views of Manhattan's skyline and plenty of opportunities for outdoor activities like jogging, cycling, and kayaking.
host_about: Happy, energetic, respectful, hardworking, caring, loving, spontaneous, outgoing, and a ray of sunshine on a cloudy day.  Resourceful, kind, unique, and loving.

name: Townhouse in Jersey City · ★4.93 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
description:
This luxuriously appointed modern 4 BR home is centrally located near downtown Jersey City just mins away from Manhattan. It sleeps 8 comfortably with one additional sleeping space available upon request. There are queen size beds throughout, beautiful decor, central air, hardwood floors and a large kitchen with Samsung appliances. This 2nd floor unit is very spacious has natural light, contactless check-in & easy access to Manhattan by train or car. Bring the whole family to this great place!

The space
This space is located close to prime shopping areas, great restaurants (Hook & Reel) my favorite is only 8 mins away
Also, the Westfield Mall, Walmart, Costco, TJMaxx and Safeway are just down the road in Bayonne. The light rail is just a 5 min walk from the house and it's a quick 7 min train ride from downtown Jersey City to Manhattan. The home is located about 15 mins (without traffic) by car from the Holland Tunnel which takes you directly into downtown
neighborhood_overview:
This is a very diverse neighborhood located it a metropolitan area. Residents on our street are mostly working professionals and retirees. The home is located on a quiet one-way street not on the main road.

You may hear the occasional sounds of emergency vehicles passing by from time to time or the garbage truck doing its rounds on trash pickup nights.

There is only street parking available on a first come basis, no designated parking. Please do not block people's driveways or park by fire hydrants because you will be ticketed.

There is alternate side parking on street cleaning days. Please ensure you pay close attention to the signs posted showing cleaning days and times to avoid getting a ticket.
host_about: I come from a humble upbringing in Jamaica and migrated to the US after graduating high school. I am an Army veteran with over 21 years of active duty service in the United States Army. I am Ivy League educated, a Columbia University alumni. I am a people person, and believe in treating others the way I want to be treated. The fear of failure motivates me and I live by high standards. I look for positivity in all things and I seriously dislike negative energy, so don't bring it around me. I love the life I live and live the life I love. Lastly, I love my peace and I always "hunt the good stuff"

description:
Welcome to Jersey City!! Located minutes away from MANY restaurants and bars!!! Venture into NYC in minutes via public transportation at Grove Street Station or ride in style thru the Holland Tunnel, which is just 10 minutes away.

If you are looking for a modern, clean and artsy space that promotes positive energy, peace and relaxation then stop your search and let us host your stay!

The space
Welcome to a Jersey City GEM!!! Luxury and character define this exposed brick condo.

The first floor of this unit steps into a hallway leading to a cozy bedroom with a queen bed and custom en suite bathroom with standing shower.

Down another hallway you will enter a master suite with a King bed and custom bathroom with standing shower. host_about:
Hi, I'm Miz!

I have lived in the NYC area for 8 years, and have been sharing my space (now spaces!) with guests since 2014. I love hosting!

I grew up in Houston, Texas, went to college in Pennsylvania, and spent time living in Italy, Spain, and Australia before moving to NYC. I currently live in Jersey City.

I am a real estate agent and property manager, and in my spare time I enjoy long walks in the neighborhood, wandering around NYC, all the self-care (massages, facials, yoga), and eating out (plus a good cocktail) with friends. 

I'm an avid traveler and have stayed with friends all over the world. I love to get a local experience when I travel, so I'm happy to provide that for my guests. My partner Mario and I host together, so you may hear or see him as well! 

Any and all questions welcome! I want to make sure you have a great time in Jersey City & NYC.

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is in northeastern New Jersey. Its eastern waterfront faces the Hudson River where it meets Upper New York Bay. Liberty State Park has panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline, the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, the former immigrant gateway. The park’s Liberty Science Center features interactive exhibits, live animals and an IMAX Dome theater. Bars and ethnic eateries line downtown’s Grove Street.
The Jersey City Heights Neighborhood in Jersey City, New Jersey
A residential neighborhood with some Victorian and Edwardian homes, The Heights has multicultural restaurants, cafes, and ice cream shops along Central Avenue. Adjacent to a large reservoir, Pershing Field features an indoor skating rink and swimming pool, while Leonard Gordon Park is known for its early-1900s buffalo and bears statues by sculptor Solon Borglum. Washington Park offers sports courts and a playground.

No matter where or with who #1 is cleanliness  #2 access and security (safe area) #3 high speed internet, wifi, bluetooth etc. and #4 location to transportation, shopping, dining and nightlife.

The Liberty Suite Team

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Jersey City, just across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan.  Jersey City’s bustling waterfront is so  packed with office tours that it is affectionately known as “Wall Street West” among locals. In all, more than 100,000 people are employed within the city. Jersey City is home to its own  thriving international dining scene, including a number of fantastic Vietnamese restaurants and James Beard Award semifinalist Rick Easton’s Bread & Salt Bakery, where you can try some amazing Roman-style pizza. There are also plenty of shops around Journal Square and Newport Centre, a shopping mall located in nearby newport. Jersey City has excellent public transportation, with both express and local buses and a light rail system. The entire area is well connected to Manhattan via NJ Transit’s PATH train system, which runs 24/7 between several stops in Jersey City and 33rd Street and the World Trade Center in  Manhattan.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

This vibrant neighborhood is a harmonious blend of retail, residential, office, and entertainment facilities, forming a dynamic and diverse urban oasis.

name: Serviced apartment in Jersey City · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Welcome to a serene stay in this well appointed 1-BR apartment in a restored traditional 1800's brick row-house, located in the heart of Jersey City Historic Downtown. This newly renovated unit has all the modern amenities, including a luxury kitchen and bathroom. Enjoy lovely walks to Hamilton, Van Vorst and Liberty State Parks or spend your time in the many neighborhood coffee shops, cafes, bars and restaurants. Getting to NYC midtown and downtown is a mere 20 min. via PATH or Ferry.

The space
This is a private 1-Bedroom Apartment, fully renovated and designed by a local Architect.

There is a private entry with digital keyed locking. The open plan Studio Living-Dining area is equipped with a full Kitchen - stainless steel appliances - refrigerator with ice machine, induction cooktop, speed oven (convection/microwave). The kitchen is fully stocked with pots/pans, utensils, dishes, glassware. There is a K-Cup coffee machine and complimentary
neighborhood_overview:
Harsimus Cove is located in the rejuvenated Historic Downtown with beautiful brownstone and brick row houses from the 1800's.

There are lovely walks to Hamilton, Van Vorst and Liberty State Parks or take walks around the streets to check out the many murals painted by local artists.

Guests can partake in the many culinary delights, including artisan coffee shops, bakeries and ice cream shops, multi-culinary restaurants and cafes. Nightlife is always hopping with trendy bars, speakeasies and beer gardens, as well as breweries and distilleries.

Convenience - Key Foods grocery is 1-Block away as are dry cleaners and shoe repairs.

Step out to a friendly neighborhood—close to restaurants, cafés, bars, shops, and PATH trains that will have you in NYC in minutes!

The space
Start your day right with a warm, buttery croissant made fresh from the bakery downstairs & a great cup of tea or coffee, decaf or regular—just the way you like from the coffee station in your upscale kitchen. With exuberant restaurants within walking distance, you may decide to dine out in Downtown every night. But it’s nice to know you have all the amenities you need to enjoy a five-star dinner around the dining table after a long day of work.

neighborhood_overview:
Greenville is located south of the West Side Branch of the Hudson-Bergen Light Rail and north of the city line with Bayonne, between the Upper New York Bay and the Newark Bay. It is a primarily residential area that consists mostly of one- and two-family homes and low-rise apartment buildings. The central core of Greenville, which is located between Garfield Avenue and West Side Avenue, is the busiest part of the neighborhood, with many small shops and businesses lining the streets.

One of the main thoroughfares in Greenville is Martin Luther King Jr. Drive, which runs through the heart of the neighborhood and provides access to many of its businesses and amenities. Other important roads in the area include Old Bergen Road and Danforth Avenue.

neighborhood_overview:
Journal Square is a business district, residential area, and transportation hub in Jersey City, New Jersey, which takes its name from the newspaper Jersey Journal whose headquarters were located there from 1911 to 2013.

The "square" itself is at the intersection of Kennedy Boulevard and Bergen Avenue.

The broader area extends to and includes Bergen Square, McGinley Square, India Square, the Five Corners and parts of the Marion Section.

This apartment is located right next to McGinley Square.

McGinley Square is in Jersey City, New Jersey, located near the middle of the city, south of Journal Square. The square itself is at the intersection of two of the city's major thoroughfares, Montgomery Street (which runs from Downtown at Exchange Place to West Side), and Bergen Avenue (which runs between Greenville and Journal Square).

This large walk-up apartment is located literally right outside the Holland tunnel which gets you straight to NYC in 2 mins. This is the closest apartment to NYC by car. You won’t get anything this large in NYC. It is in an upcoming and redevelopment area of town with many new builds in the area. It is a safe area and 5 blocks away from a major mall at Newport Centre.

The nearest train station is Newport Mall which is a few blocks away. Newport is a waterfront corporate section of Jersey City with a Mall located right at the center. There is another nearby station called Hoboken Station. Hoboken is a lively, popular, and waterfront town that hosts popular restaurants, shops, and night life. You get the best views of NYC from Hoboken and a Jersey City waterfronts.

description:
With free driveway parking for a sedan or small SUV, stay in this chic condo in historic JC Heights - perfect for a family vacation or work-cation. Enjoy stunning views of the NYC skyline from the rooftop, prepare gourmet meals from the open-concept kitchen, and relax in luxurious bedrooms with memory foam mattresses. Take advantage of nearby light rail & buses to explore Downtown JC, Hoboken & Manhattan (20 minutes), or simply walk to local coffee shops, restaurants, boutiques, and more!

The space
Spacious 3 bedroom, 2 bath house that boasts a laundry room, full gourmet kitchen, dining room, living room, and work station. Relax and take in the stunning city views from the rooftop terrace, where you can cook up a delicious meal on the 2 burner professional grill and cozy up next to the gas fire pit. The house is fully equipped with everything you need to make your stay comfortable, including cookware, plates, utensils, and basic pantry items like salt, pepper, su
neighborhood_overview: JC Heights is a closely knit, ethnically diverse and bustling neighborhood. There is always a new store or pop-up-event happening, but there are many tried and true staples within a few blocks as well. The neighborhood is flanked by 2 commercial arteries, Central and Palisade Avenue, which is home to many restaurants and conveniences including bodegas, salons, dry cleaners, post-office, flower shop, dispensaries, pharmacies, Covid-testing centers, and shoes stores. Nearby Riverview and Washington Parks are the heart of outdoor life for our neighborhood with skyline views, green spaces for picnics and walks, dog parks, playgrounds, playing fields and splash pads. If we are lucky enough to host you between May and November, you can enjoy the bounties of the Riverview Farmer’s Market every Sunday and other seasonal fairs. Below are only some of our neighborhood favorites in a 10 block radius.  If you enjoyed a particular place in our neighborhood during your stay that is not on this list,

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · 3 bedrooms · 5 beds · 1 bath
description:
Sunny, 2d-floor, private 3-bedroom residence in a charming, classic NYC/Victorian brick rowhouse overlooking a park. Fully furnished. Bus to NYC/Times Square 1 block away, (20 min. ride); or bus/train to downtown NYC or Hoboken. 3 workspaces. Park across the street offers bike-sharing, running track, ice skating/roller rink, heated public swimming pool, and tennis/basketball courts.) 1 block to supermarket and shopping/restaurant district with 20+ cuisines. Parking, $300/mo.

The space
High ceilings, sunny, south-facing living room with original 100-year old architectural details and eclectic new and antique furnishings keep you comfortable for a long-term stay. Fully equipped kitchen. Large (for NYC) 1400 sq ft. apartment. Bedroom #1 has queen size bed, and a desk. Bedroom #2 has two single beds that can be pushed together to make a king size bed, or moved apart for two singles/children. Bedroom #3 has a single bed and a work desk and makes a nice private s
neighborhood_overview:
Vibrant neighborhood full of restaurants and cuisines from around the world: Columbian, Peruvian, Italian, Mexican, Cuban, Japanese, Indian, Haitian, etc. Great upscale pub restaurant with a beautiful tree-covered courtyard and live music 4 blocks away. One of the best Italian deli/pizza/bread/donut bakeries in the New York Area, "Bread N Salt," is 10 blocks away (New York Times review). The park across the street offers bike-sharing, tennis, basketball, running track, heated swimming pool, and an ice-skating/roller rink!

There are no reviews of this apartment because we have lived in it and raised 3 children here for 22 years and this is the first time we have rented it out! We love living in this neighborhood and this apartment, but now I have a new job.

The neighborhood is safe and my wife and daughter walk to/from the bus stop and grocery store at night with no problems. It is a middle-class/extremely diverse professional/immigrant neighborhood, not a rich n
host_about: I enjoy cycling, kayaking, church, community life, hospitality, and books.  I am on the board of a wonderful non-profit—New City Kids, and have lived in Jersey City for 25 years. Previously I lived in NYC, San Diego, Germany, and Los Angeles. Jersey City beats them all! I enjoy introducing people to all that our neighborhood has to offer, in addition to the highlights of NYC.

description:
Perfect for anyone who wants to visit NYC without giving up quality or comfort, this 3BR gem is a 10 min walk to the 24/7 JSQ PATH train, which gets you into Manhattan in under 10 min. The apt offers keyless access for easy check-in, an updated kitchen, an elegant dining room, and a cozy living room perfect for both entertainment & relaxation. Whether you're exploring the city or enjoying the serene neighborhood, our thoughtfully designed apartment is the perfect home base for your stay!

The space
This is a private 2nd floor apartment in a multi-family home, we live in the downstairs unit but you’ll have full privacy unless you need any help or suggestions (we are JC natives!). We’re available when you need us and are responsive throughout every part of your stay.

The apt can comfortably sleep up to 7 people (2 per bedroom with BR3’s pull-out twin bed, 1 person on couch) and features a modern kitchen equipped with cooking essentials, spices, pots & pa
neighborhood_overview:
You'll be on a safe, quiet neighborhood in Journal Square, where you're a 10-15 minute walk to the JSQ PATH train. The PATH train gets you into Manhattan in 15 minutes via the WTC train, and 20 minutes via the 33rd St Path. The total commute time, including walking, is 29m into Lower Manhattan.

Jersey City is filled with plenty of gems that rival NYC and our home is a great place to stay if you want to enjoy the bustling city by day, and relax in the serenity of a quiet neighborhood by night. We're in walking distance to local markets, restaurants, and the JSQ PATH train that takes you into downtown JC, NYC, Newark, and Harrison in minutes.

host_about:
Our names are Kevin Song & David Wang. We are close friends. Both of us immigrate from China to the US and have been living, working, raising families in NYC metropolitan area for almost 30 years.   

Kevin was an architect many years ago and a full-time real estate investor/property manager.  

David works full-time as an IT engineer in a bank, and a real estate investor too.  

We both love to travel and always stay in Airbnb around the world. Right now, we are join together to offer our own and neighbors properties in NJ to Airbnb guests. You will definitely be pleased with our services and enjoy staying at any of our properties.

neighborhood_overview:

Our building is home to Grassroots Community Space, a business that hosts dance, yoga, music and other wellness programs, so you’re right in the heart of the art !

There are two cafes each one block away, many quick bite spots as well as upscale restaurants and bars.

Grocery and laundry are only a block away!

Other things to note
This is a co-living house.

neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Jersey City, a diverse and bustling neighborhood just a few minutes from the Journal Square transportation hub. Our community is known for its rich history, stunning architecture, and thriving art scene, making it the perfect place to stay for a dynamic and exciting vacation.

Journal Square is one of the busiest areas in Jersey City, with a large transportation hub that connects to New York City and other parts of New Jersey. The square is also home to many restaurants, shops, and theaters, making it a popular destination for locals and visitors alike.

For those who love architecture, Jersey City is a treasure trove of historic buildings and landmarks. The area around Journal Square is home to several Art Deco masterpieces, including the Loew's Jersey Theater, which hosts concerts, movie screenings, and other events throughout the year.

The wrap around farmhouse porch and private parking spot will make you feel like your'e in the country, although the home is situated steps to the light rail and other local transportation for a quick commute into NYC. host_about:
We are a group of three Italian American siblings:  Kali, Dru, and Ram.  All of us have our professional day jobs but we share a passion for family, cooking, and adventures. 
We are strong believers in the sustainable movement and we strive to be as eco friendly as  possible. We make all of our own furniture, art and other creations from reclaimed local materials! We are vegetarians and are starting a community garden on our property to distribute fresh produce to our guests and the local community. We also donate a portion of our proceeds to support our local community in providing food to the homeless. We look at AirBnB not only as a business venture, but a way to promote our beliefs in living green, healthy and happy! 
We have over 20 listings in the Jersey City area through AirBnB and we love meeting new and interesting people from all over the world everyday. We take great pride in going the extra mile to make all of our guests feel as if they were home by providing secure, clean and beautiful living spaces. We often host guest dinners where all of our guests can interact and enjoy some delicious vegetarian food and of course exchange some laughs and stories!

neighborhood_overview:
Hoboken is located across the Hudson River, directly west of Manhattan’s Chelsea and West Village. Boasting unparalleled waterfront views of Manhattan, it has a unique city vibe with a small-town feel.

The area was originally inhabited by the Lenni Lenape indigenous people who cultivated the bountiful serpentine rock of Hoboken to carve pipes. Henry Hudson, the namesake of Hudson County and Hudson River, was the first European to lay claim to the land in 1609.

In the early 1900s, NJ Transit completed tracks to Manhattan, and many shipping lines used Hoboken as a terminal port. By 1927, the Holland Tunnel was built, allowing easier travel to and from Manhattan. The Lincoln Tunnel was completed 10 years after.

With cheaper shipbuilding prices overseas, Hoboken’s dry docks dwindled. By 1970, however, an urban renewal project redeveloped the abandoned docks into mid-rise apartment buildings. During this time, many manufacturing complexes were converted into

neighborhood_overview:
The Heights and Hoboken is located across the Hudson River, directly west of Manhattan’s Chelsea and West Village. Boasting unparalleled waterfront views of Manhattan, it has a unique city vibe with a small-town feel.

The area was originally inhabited by the Lenni Lenape indigenous people who cultivated the bountiful serpentine rock of Hoboken to carve pipes. Henry Hudson, the namesake of Hudson County and Hudson River, was the first European to lay claim to the land in 1609.

In the early 1900s, NJ Transit completed tracks to Manhattan, and many shipping lines used Hoboken as a terminal port. By 1927, the Holland Tunnel was built, allowing easier travel to and from Manhattan. The Lincoln Tunnel was completed 10 years after.

With cheaper shipbuilding prices overseas, Hoboken’s dry docks dwindled. By 1970, however, an urban renewal project redeveloped the abandoned docks into mid-rise apartment buildings. During this time, many manufacturing complexes wer

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights, often simply called The Heights, is a pleasant, somewhat densely packed residential neighborhood in the northern section of Jersey City, which in turn is the second-largest city in the state of New Jersey.

Homes in the area can be most often found in the two- and three-family detached houses which sit on small lots and which dominate the housing stock here, or in the low-rise apartment buildings that also are a considerable presence in the neighborhood. There are also more than a few stately old Victorian and Edwardian houses scattered throughout the streets of the Heights with rental apartments within, especially on Sherman Place and Summit Avenue.

Rental apartments in The Heights are generally considered to be located in the area that's bordered to the south by the Bergen Arches rail tracks and The Divided Highway (also known as the Pulaski Skyway, or Route 139); to the east by Palisade Avenue (and the city of Hoboken); to the north by Patte
host_about: I worked on Wall Street for more them twenty-five years, and one of the things I loved the most about my job was the flexibility the company gave me when traveling around the world. We are very friendly and always love to have guests in our apartments. Most of the time we are traveling to new places. We enjoy meeting new people. As an avid traveler, I enjoy providing others with an affordable and comfortable place to stay.  Thank you so much.

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is a vibrant and diverse city located in the state of New Jersey, just across the Hudson River from Manhattan. Here are some highlights about Jersey City:

Location: Jersey City is just minutes away from Manhattan, making it a popular choice for people who want to travel to New York City but don't want to pay the high prices of lodging in Manhattan.

Cultural Diversity: Jersey City is home to a rich and diverse community, with people from all over the world calling it home. This diversity is reflected in the city's vibrant food scene, with a wide range of restaurants serving cuisines from around the world.

Art and Culture: Jersey City is a hub of creativity and artistic expression, with many galleries, museums, and public art installations throughout the city. The annual Jersey City Art and Studio Tour is a popular event that showcases the work of local artists.

Parks and Recreation: Jersey City has a variety of parks and green spac

neighborhood_overview: Just across the river from Manhattan, Jersey City is considered the sixth borough of New York City. There are frequent buses to Times Square just a short walk away from the apartment. Buses run every 10-15 minutes. There are plenty of local restaurants nearby with diverse and delicious cuisine.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Miz!

I have lived in the NYC area for 8 years, and have been sharing my space (now spaces!) with guests since 2014. I love hosting!

I grew up in Houston, Texas, went to college in Pennsylvania, and spent time living in Italy, Spain, and Australia before moving to NYC. I currently live in Jersey City.

I am a real estate agent and property manager, and in my spare time I enjoy long walks in the neighborhood, wandering around NYC, all the self-care (massages, facials, yoga), and eating out (plus a good cocktail) with friends. 

I'm an avid traveler and have stayed with friends all over the world. I love to get a local experience when I travel, so I'm happy to provide that for my guests. My partner Mario and I host together, so you may hear or see him as well! 

Any and all questions welcome! I want to make sure you have a great time in Jersey City & NYC.

Jersey City Heights, "The Heights" is a family friendly and safe area. There are many restaurants, groceries, bakeries, restaurants nearby. More commercial stores on Summit ave and Central ave which are a few blocks away.

Jersey City is one of the most multicultural diversity city in USA. All types of unique food and services can be find here.

For anyone who want fast access to Manhattan and reasonable dwelling price, this is idea place to stay.
host_about:
Our names are Kevin Song & David Wang. We are close friends. Both of us immigrate from China to the US and have been living, working, raising families in NYC metropolitan area for almost 30 years.   

Kevin was an architect many years ago and a full-time real estate investor/property manager.  

David works full-time as an IT engineer in a bank, and a real estate investor too.  

We both love to travel and always stay in Airbnb around the world. Right now, we are join together to offer our own and neighbors properties in NJ to Airbnb guests. You will definitely be pleased with our services and enjoy staying at any of our properties.

name: Boat in Jersey City · ★New · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Waterfront oasis meets NYC lights. Sleep on the water + under the starry sky with breathtaking NYC skyline views.

This is truly a one of a kind, magical trip with tons of adventure + attractions at your fingertips! Sleep aboard this docked boat in a secure slip located at Liberty Landing Marina in the historic Liberty State Park. Enjoy a Statue of Liberty tour, rent a jetski, enjoy the hot tub boat at the marina, and have dinner at one of the two restaurants on property with stunning views!

The space
The space is open with city views and tons of activities right on property such as kayaking, cruises to the Statue of Liberty, a 5 minute ferry ride to NYC and hot tub boat.
neighborhood_overview: Jersey City is in northeastern New Jersey. Its eastern waterfront faces the Hudson River where it meets Upper New York Bay. Liberty State Park has panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline, the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island.  The park’s Liberty Science Center features interactive exhibits, live animals and an IMAX Dome theater. Bars and ethnic eateries line downtown’s Grove Street
host_about:
Ahoy! Thank you for stopping by!

I love traveling and experiencing new places, cultures and people. And I’m so happy to share my home, which has brought me much happiness, with you. I’ve recently remodeled the space to make it perfect for your special getaway!! 

I still remember the feeling I got as a kid running along the ocean and through the farm fields of the east end….. I guess those memories were ingrained in me, and I’ve never wanted to call anywhere else home. 

The things that amaze me are the simple treasures that make this place so special — the stillness, the bright sky, the fresh air, the colors, the glistening water - this is what the east end is all about + why it’s home to so many creative minds. Plus the accessibility to stores, shops, arts, theatre, shopping is at your fingertips!

Living on the water is a hidden treasure. It’s a simple and peaceful way to be amongst endless beauty. There’s no better way to start and end the day. Please come and experience this special way of being!! And I hope it inspires you to continue your unique experiences.

Hoboken is a square mile city across the Hudson river from New York City. Hoboken is rich in night life as is boasts the most bars per square mile anywhere in the United States. Guests may take a bus or a train to Manhattan in 20 minutes. The town is extremely safe and there are tons of great places to view the Manhattan Skyline.

M&P Biancomano's: 11th and Washington Street

neighborhood_overview:
Van Vorst Park is a neighborhood in the Historic Downtown of Jersey City, Hudson County, New Jersey, centered on a park sharing the same name. The neighborhood is located west of Paulus Hook and Marin Boulevard, north of Grand Street, east of the Turnpike Extension, and south of The Village and Christopher Columbus Drive. Much of it is included in the Van Vorst Park Historical District.[3]

The park was a centerpiece of Van Vorst Township, a township that existed in Hudson County from 1841 to 1851. Van Vorst was incorporated as a township by an Act of the New Jersey Legislature on April 12, 1841, from portions of Bergen Township. On March 18, 1851, Van Vorst Township was annexed by Jersey City.[4]

The name Van Vorst comes from a prominent family in the area, the first of which arrived in the 1630s as superintendent of the patroonship Pavonia, the earliest European settlement on the west bank of the Hudson River in the province of New Netherland. His homestead at Ha

The space

neighborhood_overview:
Van Vorst Park is a historic neighborhood located in downtown Jersey City, New Jersey, just west of the bustling Grove Street area. The neighborhood is named after the beautiful and centrally-located Van Vorst Park, which serves as a popular gathering place for locals.

The Van Vorst Park neighborhood is known for its tree-lined streets, beautiful brownstones, and historic architecture. Many of the homes in the area were built in the 19th century and have been meticulously restored and maintained over the years, giving the neighborhood a charming and elegant feel.

Welcome to the best new neighbor in Jersey City, Bergen-Lafayette! We would like to invite you to experience this brand new home and everything it and the neighborhood has to offer. Only a few minute walk to Liberty Science Center and liberty state park. Restaurants, bars and downtown Jersey city only a short walk or car ride away. This 2000 sq foot 3BR 2.5 BA duplex offers 2 floors of living space and a huge backyard to keep a family of 7 comfortable and entertained for your stay!

The space
3 Bedroom 2.5 Bath duplex covering over 2000 sq ft with a full backyard, grill and outdoor furniture. Gourmet kitchen with full cookware, plates, utensils and food basics (Salt, pepper, sugar and creamers). We also have a coffee bar that includes a Nespresso machine, keurig machine, k cups, espresso pods, tea and hot chocolate. Full dining room , living room and full laundry room. Free street parking also a paid option which is a 4 minute walk to the the lot.
neighborhood_overview:
The Bergen-Lafayette section of Jersey City is home to a number of great places to eat and drink. Whether you're looking for a quick bite to eat or a sit-down meal, there's something for everyone in this vibrant neighborhood.

Some of our favorite places to eat in Bergen-Lafayette include Pinwheel Garden, Mordi's Sandwich Shop, Martha's, and Harry's Daughter. Each of these restaurants has its own unique atmosphere and offers something different for diners.

The perfect place to start the day is The Grind Coffee Shop serving not just incredible coffee, but decadent baked goods.

Pinwheel Garden is a great spot for lunch or dinner. The restaurant has a garden-like setting with an outdoor patio that's perfect for enjoying a meal on a nice day. The menu features a variety of fresh, healthy, and delicious options, making it a great choice for those looking for a healthy meal.

Welcome to Journal Square, a vibrant and diverse neighborhood in Jersey City, just minutes away from Manhattan. Here's a guide to help you navigate and explore the surrounding area:

1. Transportation: Journal Square is well-connected, offering easy access to various transportation options. The Journal Square PATH station is the heart of the neighborhood, providing direct train service to midtown Manhattan and the World Trade Center. Additionally, there are numerous bus routes and light rail options, making it convenient to explore the entire region.

neighborhood_overview:
The Bergen-Lafayette section of Jersey City is home to a number of great places to eat and drink. Whether you're looking for a quick bite to eat or a sit-down meal, there's something for everyone in this vibrant neighborhood.

Some of our favorite places to eat in Bergen-Lafayette include Pinwheel Garden, Mordi's Sandwich Shop, Martha's, and Harry's Daughter. Each of these restaurants has its own unique atmosphere and offers something different for diners.

The perfect place to start the day is The Grind Coffee Shop serving not just incredible coffee, but decadent baked goods.

Pinwheel Garden is a great spot for lunch or dinner. The restaurant has a garden-like setting with an outdoor patio that's perfect for enjoying a meal on a nice day. The menu features a variety of fresh, healthy, and delicious options, making it a great choice for those looking for a healthy meal.

Welcome to the vibrant neighborhood of Jersey City! Conveniently nestled next to the Path Tran Station, our property makes it a breeze to explore not just our local area but also Manhattan, just a quick ride away. Here's a guide to help you navigate and enjoy what our neighborhood and the city beyond has to offer:

**The Neighborhood:**
Our locale is buzzing with a mix of modern and traditional charm. We're surrounded by fantastic eateries, hip bars, and quaint coffee shops, perfect for any foodie craving or caffeine fix. Be sure to visit the local farmer's market for fresh produce or indulge in some retail therapy at the nearby boutiques.

Enjoy a peaceful morning walk or an invigorating jog at the nearby parks, each offering an oasis of greenery amidst the city bustle. On sunny days, don't miss the stunning views of the Manhattan skyline from the waterfront, a scenic gem of Jersey City.

neighborhood_overview: Known affectionately as the "sixth borough," Jersey City is staking its claim as a destination in its own right within the New York City metropolitan area. Young professionals, artists and families have flocked to the Jersey side of the Hudson in recent years and have created a city that is both an extension of Manhattan and a place where you can see and feel an authentic Jersey vibe. Visitors to New York City will find that Jersey City not only offers more reasonably-priced accommodations with easy access to the Big Apple, but also noteworthy parks, restaurants, bars and other attractions that will make for a fun and memorable trip.

host_about:
Hi, I'm Miz!

I have lived in the NYC area for 8 years, and have been sharing my space (now spaces!) with guests since 2014. I love hosting!

I grew up in Houston, Texas, went to college in Pennsylvania, and spent time living in Italy, Spain, and Australia before moving to NYC. I currently live in Jersey City.

I am a real estate agent and property manager, and in my spare time I enjoy long walks in the neighborhood, wandering around NYC, all the self-care (massages, facials, yoga), and eating out (plus a good cocktail) with friends. 

I'm an avid traveler and have stayed with friends all over the world. I love to get a local experience when I travel, so I'm happy to provide that for my guests. My partner Mario and I host together, so you may hear or see him as well! 

Any and all questions welcome! I want to make sure you have a great time in Jersey City & NYC.

name: Boat in Jersey City · ★New · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
You won’t forget your time in this romantic, memorable place. With sunsets to the west and magnificent views of Manhattan to the east you’ll never forget your time at Liberty Landing Marina, located at Statue of Liberty State Park. You can take the ferry from here into lower Manhattan to visit the city all day, then return to the boat to have a glass of wine and enjoy the views and watch the boats go by.

The space
There is a cozy state room. Please don’t expect a mansion here. It’s boat life where you can sit and watch marina life! There is an indoor galley and small kitchen where you can make coffee and a simple dinner. There is also a bathroom on the boat, but we suggest using the marina facilities where there are hot showers, and a comfy lounge for working and watching TV. This is a unique experience. If your adventurous, you’ll enjoy this experience above all others.

Guest access
The whole boat is accessible. There is a security gate to
neighborhood_overview: The Marina is located at the Statue of Liberty State Park, an enormous and beautiful park. Ironically, you cannot access Ellis Island or the Statue of Liberty from here, bust you can definitely see everything g from here.

name: Serviced apartment in Jersey City · ★New · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Welcome to the captivating allure of Jersey City, where your urban oasis awaits! A mere 30-minute jaunt from the heart of Manhattan, our playful and charismatic Airbnb listing is your gateway to East Coast delight.

The space
Relish in the convenience of professional daily cleaning, a seamless fully automated check-in process, and the assurance of smart locks gracing every door. With a fully equipped kitchen and a brand new washer and dryer, your every need is catered to with elegance and ease.

Stay seamlessly connected with our lightning-fast WiFi and be enthralled by the captivating world of 4K entertainment on our dazzling television. And let's not forget the cherry on top – our sumptuous coffee and tea station, replenished daily with an assortment of delectable treats.

Unleash your Jersey City adventure today! Secure your spot and prepare for an extraordinary journey filled with urban enchantment and endless possibilities.
host_about:
NOT YOUR TRADITIONAL AIRBNB

 BP offers a unique boutique hotel-like experience. Tap into this delight of carefully selected minimalist interiors with intelligent design properties and be astonished by our highly rated Five-Star hospitality services.

All luxurious apartments are designed and dedicated exclusively to selected Airbnb guests. 

Each location is professionally serviced daily. A thoroughly trained cleaning staff will visit each property daily, following a strict and rigorous cleaning protocol.  

This authentic approach starts with our 24-hour concierge service ensuring all your needs are met while maximizing your experience before, during, and after your stay.

Welcome to BETTI PROPERTY MANAGEMENT.

name: Hotel in Jersey City · ★New · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
description:
Experience NYC at its finest! Spacious suites and complimentary Wi-Fi access! Just miles away from iconic attractions like Madison Square Garden and Central Park, guests can explore these popular destinations in the daytime before retreating back, where they'll be greeted by friendly staff who are always ready to assist them. Nearby amazing dining options, cultural sights & activities guarantee an unforgettable experience awaiting your arrival.

The space
Located in downtown Jersey City, Sonesta Simply Suites Jersey City is walking distance to local restaurants, shops, the Newport and Exchange Place PATH trains, as well as the Hudson-Bergen Light Rail train, all while overlooking the stunning Manhattan Skyline. Whether you are exploring the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island or making your way into Manhattan to visit The World Trade Center or Empire State Building our hotels location is ideal to easily get you to where you want to be. Our all-suite room types are

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★New · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
description:
Stylish, central en-suite room in high-rise 2B2B apartment.
[Location] 4min walk to Exchange Pl path station, one stop to World Trade Center.
[Room] Full size bed with private bathroom, dedicated desk, walk-in closet. Window overlooks Hudson River and Manhattan skyline.
[Duration] 1 month up only. Must respect the other roommate.
[House rules] 1 person occupancy only. Share kitchen with the other roommate. No party in apartment. You can book the building's party amenities with Host.
host_about: Hi there, I'm Angie. I'm an independent art curator who travels a lot on Airbnb as well as hosting other travellers while I travel. I spent the 7 months travelling in Europe completely on Airbnb and it was a wonderful wonderful experience! I can't wait to visit more Airbnb houses, meet more people, and welcome travellers into my exquisitely curated home!
